member.summary: The Button is a graphical user interface element that triggers an event on its click action. It can contain a text, an image, or both.

member.summary: Sets id attribute for button element.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfButton.ChildContent
member.summary: Sets content for button element including HTML and its customizations.

member.summary: Defines the text content of the button element and it will support only string type.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfButton.CssClass
member.summary: Defines class/multiple classes separated by a space in the button element. The Button types, styles, and size can be defined by using this property.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfButton.Disabled
member.summary: Specifies a value that indicates whether the Button is enabled or disabled.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfButton.EnableRtl
member.summary: Enable or disable rendering Button component in right to left direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfButton.IconCss
member.summary: Defines class/multiple classes separated by a space for the Button that is used to include an icon. Buttons can also include font icon and sprite image.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfButton.IconPosition
member.summary: Positions the icon based on the text content in the button and its default value is Left. The possible values are: Left: The icon will be positioned to the left of the text content. Right: The icon will be positioned to the right of the text content. Top: The icon will be positioned to the top of the text content. Bottom: The icon will be positioned to the bottom of the text content.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfButton.IsPrimary
member.summary: Allows the appearance of the button to be enhanced and visually appealing when set to true.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.CalendarBase`1
member.summary: The Calendar is a graphical user interface component that displays a Gregorian Calendar, and allows a user to select a date.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.CalendarBase`1.ValueExpression
member.summary: Specifies the expression for defining the value of the bound.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.CalendarBase`1.Max
member.summary: Specifies a maximum date that is allowed a user can select in the calendar.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.CalendarBase`1.Min
member.summary: Specifies a minimum date that is allowed a user can select in the calendar.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.CalendarBase`1.FirstDayOfWeek
member.summary: Sets the calendar's first day of the week. By default, the first day of the week will be based on the current culture.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.CalendarBase`1.CalendarMode
member.summary: Sets the calendar's type like Gregorian.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.CalendarBase`1.DayHeaderFormat
member.summary:
Specifies the format of the day that to be displayed in the header. By default, the format is short.
Possible formats are:
Short Sets the short format of day name (like Su ) in day header.
Narrow Sets the single character of day name (like S ) in day header.
Abbreviated Sets the min format of day name (like Sun ) in day header.
Wide Sets the long format of day name (like Sunday ) in day header.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.CalendarBase`1.Depth
member.summary:
Sets the maximum level of views such as a month, year, and decade in the calendar.
The depth view should be smaller than the start view to restrict its view navigation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.CalendarBase`1.EnablePersistence
member.summary: Enable or disable persisting component's state between page reloads. If enabled, the following list of states will be persisted.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.CalendarBase`1.KeyConfigs
member.summary:
Customizes the key actions in the calendar.
For example, when using a German keyboard, the key actions can be customized using these shortcuts.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.CalendarBase`1.Start
member.summary: Specifies the initial view of the calendar when it is opened. With the help of this property, the initial view can be changed to the year or decade view.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.CalendarBase`1.ServerTimezoneOffset
member.summary:
By default, the date value will be processed based on the system time zone.
If you want to process the initial date value using the server time zone then specify the time zone value to the ServerTimezoneOffset property.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.CalendarBase`1.Locale
member.summary: Specifies the global culture and localization of the calendar.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.CalendarBase`1.ShowTodayButton
member.summary: Specifies whether the today button will be displayed in the calendar.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.CalendarBase`1.WeekNumber
member.summary: Specifies whether the week number of the year will be displayed in the calendar.

member.summary: Gets or sets the selected date of the Calendar.

member.summary: Specifies the CSS class name that can be appended with the root element of the DatePicker. One or more custom CSS classes can be added to a DatePicker.

member.summary: Enable or disable rendering component in right to left direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1.Enabled
member.summary: Specifies a boolean value that indicates whether the DatePicker allows the user to interact with it.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1.FloatLabelType
member.summary:
Specifies the floating label behavior of the DatePicker that the placeholder text floats above the DatePicker based on the following values.
Possible values are:
Never Never floats the label in the DatePicker when the placeholder is available.
Always The floating label always floats above the DatePicker.
Auto The floating label floats above the DatePicker after focusing it or when enters the value in it.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1.Format
member.summary:
Specifies the format of the value that to be displayed in component.
By default, the format is based on the culture.
You can set the format to "format:'dd/MM/yyyy hh:mm'".

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1.HtmlAttributes
member.summary:
You can add the additional html attributes such as styles, class, and more to the root element.
If you configured both the property and equivalent html attribute, then the component considers the property value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1.InputAttributes
member.summary:
You can add the additional input attributes such as disabled, value, and more to the root element.
If you configured both the property and equivalent input attribute, then the component considers the property value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDatePicker`1.Placeholder
member.summary: Specifies the text that is shown as a hint or placeholder until the user focuses or enter a value in DatePicker. The property is depending on the FloatLabelType property.

member.summary: Specifies a boolean value whether the DateRangePicker allows user to change the value via typing. When set as false, the DateRangePicker allows user to change the value via picker only.

member.summary: Specifies the CSS class name that can be appended with the root element of the DateRangePicker. One or more custom CSS classes can be added to a DateRangePicker.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateRangePickerModel.Depth
member.summary:
Sets the maximum level of view (Month, Year, Decade) in the Calendar.
Depth view should be smaller than the Start view to restrict its view navigation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateRangePickerModel.EnablePersistence
member.summary:
Enable or disable the persisting DateRangePicker's state between the page reloads. If enabled, following list of states will be persisted.
StartDate
EndDate
Value

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateRangePickerModel.EnableRtl
member.summary: Enable or disable rendering DateRangePicker in right to left direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateRangePickerModel.Enabled
member.summary: Specifies a boolean value that indicates whether the DateRangePicker allows the user to interact with it.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateRangePickerModel.EndDate
member.summary: Gets or sets the end date of the date range selection.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateRangePickerModel.FirstDayOfWeek
member.summary: Sets the calendar's first day of the week. By default, the first day of the week will be based on the current culture.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateRangePickerModel.FloatLabelType
member.summary:
Specifies the floating label behavior of the DateRangePicker that the placeholder text floats above the DateRangePicker based on the following values.
Possible values are:
Never Never floats the label in the DateRangePicker when the placeholder is available.
Always The floating label always floats above the DateRangePicker.
Auto The floating label floats above the DateRangePicker after focusing it or when enters the value in it.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateRangePickerModel.Format
member.summary:
Specifies the format of the value that to be displayed in DateRangePicker.
By default, the format is based on the culture.
You can set the format to "format:'dd/MM/yyyy hh:mm'".

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateRangePickerModel.HtmlAttributes
member.summary:
You can add the additional input attributes such as disabled, value, and more to the root element.
If you configured both the property and equivalent input attribute, then the DateRangePicker considers the property value.

member.summary: Customizes the key actions in DateRangePicker. For example, when using German keyboard, the key actions can be customized using these shortcuts.

member.summary: Specifies the global culture and localization of the DateRangePicker.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.DateTimePickerModel`1.DayHeaderFormat
member.summary:
Specifies the format of the day that to be displayed in the header. By default, the format is Short.
Possible formats are:
Short Sets the short format of day name (like Su ) in day header.
Narrow Sets the single character of day name (like S ) in day header.
Abbreviated Sets the min format of day name (like Sun ) in day header.
Wide Sets the long format of day name (like Sunday ) in day header.

member.summary: Specifies the CSS class name that can be appended with the root element of the DateRangePicker. One or more custom CSS classes can be added to a DateRangePicker.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDateRangePicker.DayHeaderFormat
member.summary:
Specifies the format of the day that to be displayed in the header. By default, the format is Short.
Possible formats are:
Short Sets the short format of day name (like Su ) in day header.
Narrow Sets the single character of day name (like S ) in day header.
Abbreviated Sets the min format of day name (like Sun ) in day header.
Wide Sets the long format of day name (like Sunday ) in day header.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDateRangePicker.Depth
member.summary:
Sets the maximum level of view (Month, Year, Decade) in the Calendar.
Depth view should be smaller than the Start view to restrict its view navigation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDateRangePicker.EnablePersistence
member.summary:
Enable or disable the persisting DateRangePicker's state between the page reloads. If enabled, following list of states will be persisted.
StartDate
EndDate
Value

member.summary: Enable or disable rendering DateRangePicker in right to left direction.

member.summary: Specifies a boolean value that indicates whether the DateRangePicker allows the user to interact with it.

member.summary: Gets or sets the end date of the date range selection.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDateRangePicker.EndDateChanged
member.summary: Triggers when end date of the DateRangePicker is changed.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDateRangePicker.FirstDayOfWeek
member.summary: Gets or sets the Calendar's first day of the week. By default, the first day of the week will be based on the current culture.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDateRangePicker.FloatLabelType
member.summary:
Specifies the floating label behavior of the DateRangePicker that the placeholder text floats above the DateRangePicker based on the following values.
Possible values are:
Never Never floats the label in the DateRangePicker when the placeholder is available.
Always The floating label always floats above the DateRangePicker.
Auto The floating label floats above the DateRangePicker after focusing it or when enters the value in it.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDateRangePicker.Format
member.summary:
Sets or gets the required date format to the start and end date string.
By default, the format is based on the culture.
You can set the format to "format:'dd/MM/yyyy hh:mm'".

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Calendars.SfDateRangePicker.HtmlAttributes
member.summary:
You can add the additional input attributes such as disabled, value, and more to the root element.
If you configured both the property and equivalent input attribute, then the DateRangePicker considers the property value.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Adaptors
member.summary:
Specifies the data adaptors
BlazorAdaptor Default. BlazorAdaptor is used to process Enumerable data. It contains methods to process the given collection based on the queries.
ODataAdaptor
OData Adaptor provies ability to consume and manipulate data from OData services.
ODataV4Adaptor
ODatav4 Adaptor provies ability to consume and manipulate data from OData v4 services
WebApiAdaptor
WebApi Adaptor provies ability to consume and manipulate data from WebApi services. This adaptor is targeted to interact with Web API created using OData endpoint, it is extended from ODataAdaptor
UrlAdaptor
URL Adaptor is used when you are required to interact with all kind of remote services to retrieve data.
RemoteSaveAdaptor
Remote Save Adaptor is used for binding JSON data. It interacts with remote services only for CRUD operations.
CustomAdaptor
CustomAdaptor specifies that own data query and manipulation logic has been provided using custom adaptor component extended from DataAdaptor class.
JsonAdaptor
JsonAdaptor is used to process JSON data at the client side. It contains methods to process the given JSON data based on the queries.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Adaptors.JsonAdaptor
member.summary: JsonAdaptor is used to process JSON data at the client side. It contains methods to process the given JSON data based on the queries.

member.summary: BlazorAdaptor is used to process Enumerable data. It contains methods to process the given collection based on the queries.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.DataManager
member.summary: The DataManager is a data management component used for performing data operations in applications. It acts as an abstraction for using local data source - IEnumerable and remote data source - web services returning JSON or oData.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DataManager.Url
member.summary: Specifies the endpoint URL. DataManager requests this URL when data is needed.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DataManager.AdaptorInstance
member.summary: Specifies the custom adaptor class type. DataManager uses this type value to instantiate custom adaptor class.
member.remarks: DataManager uses Activator.CreateInstance method to create custom adaptor instance. Injecting services into custom adaptor class, is not supported while using this approach. To inject and use services, provide custom adaptor as a Blazor component by extending DataAdaptor class.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DataManager.Adaptor
member.summary:
Gets or sets the data adaptor to be used by DataManager.
BlazorAdaptor Default. BlazorAdaptor is used to process Enumerable data. It contains methods to process the given collection based on the queries.
ODataAdaptor
OData Adaptor provies ability to consume and manipulate data from OData services.
ODataV4Adaptor
ODatav4 Adaptor provies ability to consume and manipulate data from OData v4 services
WebApiAdaptor
WebApi Adaptor provies ability to consume and manipulate data from WebApi services. This adaptor is targeted to interact with Web API created using OData endpoint, it is extended from ODataAdaptor
UrlAdaptor
URL Adaptor is used when you are required to interact with all kind of remote services to retrieve data.
RemoteSaveAdaptor
Remote Save Adaptor is used for binding JSON data. It interacts with remote services only for CRUD operations.
CustomAdaptor
CustomAdaptor specifies that own data query and manipulation logic has been provided using custom adaptor component extended from DataAdaptor class.
JsonAdaptor
JsonAdaptor is used to process JSON data at the client side. It contains methods to process the given JSON data based on the queries.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DataManager.DataAdaptor
member.summary: Holds adaptor instance.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DataManager.DotNetObjectRef
member.summary: Holds dotnet instance.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DataManager.InsertUrl
member.summary: Specifies the insert URL.
member.remarks: Applicable for remote adaptors. When Insert method is called, request will be made to InsertUrl. If InsertUrl is not provided, Url is used as fallback.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DataManager.RemoveUrl
member.summary: Specifies the remove URL.
member.remarks: Applicable for remote adaptors. When Remove method is called, request will be made to RemoveUrl. If RemoveUrl is not provided, Url is used as fallback.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DataManager.UpdateUrl
member.summary: Specifies the update URL.
member.remarks: Applicable for remote adaptors. When Update method is called, request will be made to UpdateUrl. If UpdateUrl is not provided, Url is used as fallback.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DataManager.CrudUrl
member.summary: Specifies the CRUD URL.
member.remarks: Applicable for remote adaptors. When Insert, Remove or Update method is called, request will be made to CrudUrl. If CrudUrl is not provided, Url is used as fallback.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DataManager.BatchUrl
member.summary: Specifies the batch url.
member.remarks: Applicable for remote adaptors. When SaveChanges method is called, request will be made to BatchUrl. If BatchUrl is not provided, Url is used as fallback.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.BasicShapeMargin
member.summary: Specifies the space around the basic shape.

example.code:
<SfDiagram Height="600px" Nodes="@NodeCollection">
            </SfDiagram>
            @code
            {
              //Initialize node collection with node
              ObservableCollection<DiagramNode> NodeCollection = new ObservableCollection<DiagramNode>()
             {
               //Creates a basic shape node
               new DiagramNode()
               {
                Id="node1",
                //Size of the node
                Height=100,
                Width=100,
                Shape=new DiagramShape (){Type=Shapes.Basic,BasicShape=BasicShapes.Rectangle,Margin = new BasicShapeMargin(){ Top = 10, Left = 10, Bottom = 10, Right = 10} }
                }
              };
             }

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.BasicShapeMargin.#ctor
member.summary: Specifies the space around the basic shape.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.ConnectorAnnotationDragLimit
member.summary: It allows the user to limit the dragging of Connector Annotation to a certain distance.

example.code:
<SfDiagram Height="600px" Connectors="@ConnectorCollection">    
            </SfDiagram> 
            @code  
            {  
              Annotations = new ObservableCollection<DiagramConnectorAnnotation>()
                {
                    new DiagramConnectorAnnotation()
                    {
                     Content = "Annotation", Constraints = AnnotationConstraints.Select | AnnotationConstraints.Drag,
                     DragLimit = new ConnectorAnnotationDragLimit() { Left = 10, Top = 10, Right = 10, Bottom = 10 } 
                     },
                 }
             }

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.ConnectorAnnotationDragLimit.#ctor
member.summary: It allows the user to limit the dragging of Connector Annotation to a certain distance.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.NodeAnnotationDragLimit
member.summary: Specifies whether the node annotation can be moved or not.

example.code:
<SfDiagram Height="600px" Nodes="@NodeCollection">
            </SfDiagram>
            @code{
                public ObservableCollection<DiagramNode> NodeCollection = new ObservableCollection<DiagramNode>() { };
                protected override void OnInitialized()
                {
                  // A node is created and stored in the node array.
                  DiagramNode Node = new DiagramNode()
                  {
                     // Position of the node
                     OffsetX = 250,
                     OffsetY = 250,
                    // Size of the node
                    Width = 100,
                    Height = 100,
                    Style = new NodeShapeStyle() { Fill = "#6BA5D7", StrokeColor = "white" },
                    // Initialize port collection
                    Annotations = new ObservableCollection<DiagramNodeAnnotation>()
                    {
                      // An annotation is created and stored in an Annotation collection of Node.
                      new DiagramNodeAnnotation() { Content = "Annotation",
                      Constraints=  AnnotationConstraints.Select|AnnotationConstraints.Drag,
                      DragLimit = new NodeAnnotationDragLimit(){Top = 30, Left = 0 ,Right = 20, Bottom = 20 } }
                     }
                   };
                  NodeCollection.Add(Node);
                 }
             }

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.NodeAnnotationDragLimit.#ctor
member.summary: Specifies whether the node annotation can be moved or not.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.ConnectorAnnotationMargin
member.summary: Specifies the space around the connector annotation.

example.code:
<SfDiagram Height="600px" Connectors="@ConnectorCollection">    
            </SfDiagram> 
            @code
            {
               //Defines diagram's connector collection
               public ObservableCollection<DiagramConnector> ConnectorCollection { get; set; } 
               protected override void OnInitialized()
               {
                 ConnectorCollection = new ObservableCollection<DiagramConnector>();
                 DiagramConnector Connector = new DiagramConnector()
                 {
                    SourcePoint = new ConnectorSourcePoint() { X = 300, Y = 40 },
                    TargetPoint = new ConnectorTargetPoint() { X = 400, Y = 160 },
                    Type = Segments.Orthogonal,
                    Style = new ConnectorShapeStyle() { StrokeColor = "#6BA5D7" },
                    Annotations = new ObservableCollection<DiagramConnectorAnnotation>()
                    {
                      new DiagramConnectorAnnotation() { Content = "Annotation length will be varied", Width = 50, Height = 50 ,Margin = new ConnectorAnnotationMargin(){ Left=10} },
                    }
                  };
                  ConnectorCollection.Add(Connector);
                }
             }

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.ConnectorAnnotationMargin.#ctor
member.summary: Specifies the space around the connector annotation.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.ConnectorMargin
member.summary: Specifies the space around the connector.

example.code:
<SfDiagram Connectors="@ConnectorCollection">
            </SfDiagram>
            @code
            {
               public ObservableCollection<DiagramConnector> ConnectorCollection = new ObservableCollection<DiagramConnector>();
               protected override void OnInitialized()
               {
                 DiagramConnector DiagramConnector = new DiagramConnector()
                 {
                    SourcePoint = new ConnectorSourcePoint() { X = 100, Y = 100 },
                    TargetPoint = new ConnectorTargetPoint() { X = 200, Y = 200 },
                     Margin = new ConnectorMargin()
                    {
                      Bottom = 10,
                      Top = 10,
                      Left = 10,
                      Right = 10
                     }
                   };
                   ConnectorCollection.Add(DiagramConnector);
                }
            }

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramUserHandleMargin
member.summary: Represents the space around the user handle.

example.code:
<SfDiagram Height="600px" Nodes="@NodeCollection" SelectedItems="@SelectedModel">
            </SfDiagram>
            @code{
                // Defines diagram's nodes collection
                public ObservableCollection<DiagramNode> NodeCollection { get; set; }
                // Defines diagram's SelectedItems
                public Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramSelectedItems SelectedModel { get; set; }
                ObservableCollection<DiagramUserHandle> UserHandles { get; set; }
                protected override void OnInitialized()
                {
                    //Creating the user handle for cloning the objects
                     DiagramUserHandle CloneHandle = new DiagramUserHandle()
                      {
                        //Name of the user handle
                        Name = "clone",
                        //Set pathdata for userhandle
                        PathData = "M60.3,18H27.5c-3,0-5.5,2.4-5.5,5.5v38.2h5.5V23.5h32.7V18z M68.5,28.9h-30c-3,0-5.5,2.4-5.5,5.5v38.2c0,3,2.4,5.5,5.5,5.5h30c3,0,5.5-2.4,5.5-5.5V34.4C73.9,31.4,71.5,28.9,68.5,28.9z M68.5,72.5h-30V34.4h30V72.5z",
                        //set margin to the user handle
                        Margin = new DiagramUserHandleMargin() { Top = 10, Bottom = 10, Left = 20, Right = 0 }
                        };
                        //Add user handle to the user handle collection
                        UserHandles = new ObservableCollection<DiagramUserHandle>()
                        {
                         CloneHandle
                        };
                        SelectedModel = new Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramSelectedItems()
                         {
                          //Enable user handle for selected items...
                          Constraints = SelectorConstraints.UserHandle,
                          UserHandles = this.UserHandles
                         };
                         NodeCollection = new ObservableCollection<DiagramNode>();
                         DiagramNode DiagramNode = new DiagramNode()
                         {
                           Id = "node1",
                           OffsetX = 100,
                           OffsetY = 100,
                           Width = 100,
                           Height = 100,
                           Style = new NodeShapeStyle() { Fill = "#659be5", StrokeColor = "none" },
                         };
                        NodeCollection.Add(DiagramNode);
                       }
                 }
              }

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.NodeMargin
member.summary: Sets the outer space for a node on all the four sides. By default, the margin is set to 0 in all the four sides.

example.code:
<SfDiagram Height="600px" Nodes="@NodeCollection">
            </SfDiagram>
            @code{
               public ObservableCollection<DiagramNode> NodeCollection = new ObservableCollection<DiagramNode>() { };
               protected override void OnInitialized()
               {
                   DiagramNode Node = new DiagramNode()
                   {
                       OffsetX = 250,
                       OffsetY = 250,
                       Width = 100,
                       Height = 100,
                       Margin = new NodeMargin()
                       {
                           Bottom = 20,
                           Left = 20,
                           Right = 20,
                           Top = 20
                       }
                   };
                   NodeCollection.Add(Node);
               }
            }

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.PortMargin
member.summary: Represents the space from the actual offset values of the port.
member.remarks: By default, it will be 0 from all sides. The following code shows how to define PortMargin and its properties.

example.code:
<SfDiagram Height="600px" Nodes="@NodeCollection">
            </SfDiagram>
            @code{
              public ObservableCollection<DiagramNode> NodeCollection = new ObservableCollection<DiagramNode>() { };
              protected override void OnInitialized()
              {
               // A node is created and stored in nodes collection.
               DiagramNode Node = new DiagramNode()
               {
                   // Position of the node
                   OffsetX = 250,
                   OffsetY = 250,
                   // Size of the node
                   Width = 100,
                   Height = 100,
                   Style = new NodeShapeStyle() { Fill = "#6BA5D7", StrokeColor = "white" },
                   // Initialize port collection
                   Ports = new ObservableCollection<DiagramPort>() {
                   new DiagramPort() {
                       Id = "port1", Visibility = PortVisibility.Visible,
                       //Set the style for the port
                       Style= new PortShapeStyle(){ Fill="gray"},
                       //set the margin to the port
                       Margin = new PortMargin{Top= 10,Bottom=0,Left=10,Right=0}
                       }
                     },
                 };
                 NodeCollection.Add(Node);
               }
            }

member.summary: Represents the space from the actual offset values of the port.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.CancelOffset
member.summary: Represents the position of the cancel port.

tr.td: CancelOffset is used to set the fraction relative to the parent that represents the position of the Cancel port. Fraction value ranges from 0 to 1.
1. When x= 0 and y = 0, then the cancel port will be position at the top left corner of the node.
2. When x= 0.5 and y = 0.5, then the cancel port will be position at the center of the node.
3. When x= 1 and y = 1, then the cancel port will be position at the bottom right corner of the node.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.CancelOffset.#ctor
member.summary: Represents the position of the cancel port.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.FailureOffset
member.summary: Represents the position of the failure port.

tr.td: FailureOffset is used to set the fraction relative to the parent that represents the position of the Failure port. Fraction value ranges from 0 to 1.
1. When x= 0 and y = 0, then the failure port will be position at the top left corner of the node.
2. When x= 0.5 and y = 0.5, then the failure port will be position at the center of the node.
3. When x= 1 and y = 1, then the failure port will be position at the bottom right corner of the node.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.CancelSubEvent
member.summary: Represents the event within another subprocess.

example.code:
<SfDiagram Height="600px" Nodes="@NodeCollection">   
            </SfDiagram>
            @code {
               //Initialize the node collection with node
               ObservableCollection<DiagramNode> NodeCollection = new ObservableCollection<DiagramNode>()
               {
                   new DiagramNode()
                   {
                       // Position of the node
                       OffsetX = 100, OffsetY = 100,
                       // Size of the node
                       Width = 100, Height = 100,
                       // Unique id of the node
                       Id = "node1",
                       //Defines the type to BPMN and shape to activity
                       Shape = new DiagramShape()
                       {
                           Type = Shapes.Bpmn,
                           BpmnShape = BpmnShapes.Activity,
                           //Sets the activity to subprocess
                           Activity = new DiagramBpmnActivity()
                           {
                               Activity = BpmnActivities.SubProcess,
                               //Sets collapsed to true and type to Transaction
                               SubProcess = new DiagramBpmnSubProcess()
                               {
                                   Collapsed = true,
                                   Type = BpmnSubProcessTypes.Transaction,
                                   //Sets offset and visible for cancel and offset for failure
                                   Transaction = new DiagramBpmnTransactionSubProcess()
                                   {
                                       Cancel = new CancelSubEvent(){ Visible = true, Offset = new BpmnSubEventOffset(){ X = 0.25, Y = 1}},
                                       Failure = new FailureSubEvent(){ Offset = new BpmnSubEventOffset(){ X = 0.75, Y = 1}}
                                   }
                               },
                           }
                       }
                   }
               };
            }

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramBpmnActivity
member.summary: Represents the task that is performed in a business process.

tr.td: There are two types of activities. They are listed as follows:
1.Task: This occurs within a process and it is not broken down to a finer level of detail.
2.Subprocess: This occurs within a process and it is broken down to a finer level of detail.

example.code:
<SfDiagram Height="600px" Nodes="@NodeCollection">
            </SfDiagram>
            @code{
               //Initialize the node collection with node
               ObservableCollection<DiagramNode> NodeCollection = new ObservableCollection<DiagramNode>()
               {
                 new DiagramNode()
                 {
                   //Position of the node
                   OffsetX = 100, OffsetY = 100,
                   //Size of the node
                   Width = 100, Height = 100,
                   //Unique Id of the node
                   Id = "node1",
                   //sets the type of shape to Bpmn and shape to activity
                   Shape = new DiagramShape()
                   {
                     Type = Shapes.Bpmn,
                     BpmnShape = BpmnShapes.Activity,
                     //Sets the activity type to task
                     Activity = new DiagramBpmnActivity(){ Activity = BpmnActivities.Task },
                    }
                   }
                };
               }

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramBpmnActivity.#ctor
member.summary: Represents the task that is performed in a business process.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramBpmnActivity.Activity
member.summary: Specifies the type of activity to be performed.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramBpmnActivity.SubProcess
member.summary: Specifies the group of tasks that are used to hide or reveal details of an additional level using the collapsed property.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramBpmnActivity.Task
member.summary: Specifies the type of task such as sending, receiving, etc. By default, the task is set to None

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramBpmnAnnotation
member.summary: Represents to connect an annotation element to the BPMN node.

tr.td: A BPMN object can be associated with a text annotation that does not affect the flow but gives details about objects within a flow. The annotation element can be switched from a BPMN node to another BPMN node simply by dragging the source end of the annotation connector into the other BPMN node.

example.code:
<SfDiagram Height="600px" Nodes="@NodeCollection">
            </SfDiagram>
            @code{
              //Initialize the node collection with node
              ObservableCollection<DiagramNode> NodeCollection = new ObservableCollection<DiagramNode>()
              {
                 new DiagramNode()
                 {
                    //Position of the node
                    OffsetX = 100,
                    OffsetY = 100,
                    //Size of the node
                    Width = 100,
                    Height = 100,
                    //Unique Id of the node
                    Id = "node1",
                    //Sets type as BPMN and shape as DataObject
                    Shape = new DiagramShape()
                    {
                      Type = Shapes.Bpmn,
                      BpmnShape=BpmnShapes.DataObject,
                      //Sets collection as true when Dataobject is not a Single instance
                      DataObject=new DiagramBpmnDataObject()
                      {
                        Collection=true,
                        Type=BpmnDataObjects.Input
                      }
                     },
                     //Sets the id, angle, and text for the annotation
                     Annotations=new ObservableCollection<DiagramNodeAnnotation>()
                     {
                     new DiagramNodeAnnotation()
                     {
                        Id="Left",
                        RotateAngle=45,
                        Content="Left"
                      }
                    }
                 },
               };
             }

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramBpmnAnnotation.#ctor

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramBpmnDataObject
member.summary: Represents the behavior of the Bpmn data object.

tr.td: A data object represents information flowing through the process, such as data placed into the process, data resulting from the process, data that needs to be collected, or data that must be stored. To define a DataObject, set the shape to DataObject and the type of property defines whether data is an input or output. Users can create multiple instances of the data object with the collection property of data.

example.code:
<SfDiagram ID="Diagram" Height="600px" Nodes="@NodeCollection">
            </SfDiagram>
            @code{
             //Initialize the node collection with node
             ObservableCollection<DiagramNode> NodeCollection = new ObservableCollection<DiagramNode>()
             {
               new DiagramNode()
               {
                 //Position of the node
                 OffsetX = 100,
                 OffsetY = 100,
                 //Size of the node
                 Width = 100,
                 Height = 100,
                 //Unique Id of the node
                 Id = "node1",
                 //Sets type to Bpmn and shape to DataObject
                 Shape = new DiagramShape()
                 {
                    Type = Shapes.Bpmn,
                    BpmnShape=BpmnShapes.DataObject,
                    //Sets collection to true when Dataobject is not a Single instance
                    DataObject=new DiagramBpmnDataObject()
                    {
                      Collection=true,
                      Type=BpmnDataObjects.Input
                     }
                  }
                 },
                };
               }

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramBpmnDataObject.#ctor
member.summary: Represents the behavior of the Bpmn data object.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramBpmnDataObject.Collection
member.summary: Specifies whether the data object is a collection or not. By default, it is set to false.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramBpmnDataObject.Type
member.summary: Specifies whether the data is an input or output. By default, it is set to None.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramBpmnEvent
member.summary: Represents something happens during a business process and it is notated with a circle.

tr.td: The type of events are as follows:
• Start - indicates the beginning of the process and every business process starts with an event.
• Intermediate - indicates the middle of the process.
• End - indicates the beginning of the process and every business process ends with an event.

example.code:
<SfDiagram Height="600px" Nodes="@NodeCollection">
            </SfDiagram>
            @code{
                //Initialize the node collection with node
               ObservableCollection<DiagramNode> NodeCollection = new ObservableCollection<DiagramNode>()
               {
                  new DiagramNode()
                  {
                    //Position of the node
                    OffsetX = 100, OffsetY = 100,
                    //Size of the node
                    Width = 100, Height = 100,
                    //Unique Id of the node
                    Id = "node1",
                    Shape = new DiagramShape()
                    {
                       //Sets type to Bpmn and shape to Event
                       Type = Shapes.Bpmn, BpmnShape = BpmnShapes.Event,
                       // Set the event type to End
                       Event = new DiagramBpmnEvent() { Event = BpmnEvents.End }
                     }
                    }
                };
              }

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramBpmnEvent.#ctor
member.summary: Represents something happens during a business process and it is notated with a circle.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramBpmnEvent.Event
member.summary: It allows the user to define the type of event. The default value of the event is Start.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramBpmnEvent.Trigger

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramBpmnGateway
member.summary: Represents to control the flow of a process and it is represented as a diamond shape.

tr.td: To create a gateway, the shape property of the node should be set to “Gateway” and the Gateway property can be set with any of the appropriate gateways.

example.code:
<SfDiagram Height="600px" Nodes="@NodeCollection">
            </SfDiagram>
                @code{
                 //Initialize the node collection with node
                 ObservableCollection<DiagramNode> NodeCollection = new ObservableCollection<DiagramNode>()
                 {
                   new DiagramNode()
                   {
                     //Position of the node
                     OffsetX = 100, OffsetY = 100,
                     //Size of the node
                     Width = 100, Height = 100,
                     //Unique Id of the node
                     Id = "node1",
                     Shape = new DiagramShape()
                     {
                         //Sets type to Bpmn and shape to Gateway
                         Type = Shapes.Bpmn, BpmnShape = BpmnShapes.Gateway,
                         //Sets type of the gateway to None
                         Gateway = new DiagramBpmnGateway(){Type = BpmnGateways.None}
                     }
                    }
                  };
                 }

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramBpmnGateway.#ctor
member.summary: Represents to control the flow of a process and it is represented as a diamond shape.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramBpmnGateway.Type
member.summary: Specifies the type of BpmnGateway. By default, the Gateway will be set to None.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramBpmnSubEvent
member.summary: Represents the event placed within another subprocess.

tr.td: Users can set an event to a subprocess with the event and trigger the properties of the subprocess. The Type property of the subprocess allows you to define the type of subprocess.

example.code:
<SfDiagram Height="600px" Nodes="@NodeCollection">
            </SfDiagram>
              @code {    
              //Initialize the node collection with node
              ObservableCollection<DiagramNode> NodeCollection = new ObservableCollection<DiagramNode>()
              {
                new DiagramNode()
               {
                  // Position of the node
                  OffsetX = 100, OffsetY = 100,
                  // Size of the node
                  Width = 100, Height = 100,
                  // Unique id of the node
                  Id = "node1",
                  //Defines the type to BPMN and shape to activity
                  Shape = new DiagramShape()
                  {
                     Type = Shapes.Bpmn,
                     BpmnShape = BpmnShapes.Activity,
                     //Sets the activity to subprocess
                     Activity = new DiagramBpmnActivity()
                     {
                        Activity = BpmnActivities.SubProcess,
                        //Sets collapsed to true and type to Transaction
                        SubProcess = new DiagramBpmnSubProcess()
                        {
                           Collapsed = true,
                           Type = BpmnSubProcessTypes.Transaction,
                           //Sets offset and visible for cancel and offset for failure
                           Transaction = new DiagramBpmnTransactionSubProcess()
                            {
                              Cancel = new CancelSubEvent(){ Visible = true, Offset = new BpmnSubEventOffset(){ X = 0.25, Y = 1}},
                              Failure = new FailureSubEvent(){ Offset = new BpmnSubEventOffset(){ X = 0.75, Y = 1}}
                             }
                        },
                     }
                    }
                   }
                  };
                }

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramBpmnSubProcess
member.summary: This occurs within a process and it is broken down to a finer level of detail.

example.code:
<SfDiagram Height="600px" Nodes="@NodeCollection">
            </SfDiagram>
            @code
            {    
              //Initialize the node collection with node
              ObservableCollection<DiagramNode> NodeCollection = new ObservableCollection<DiagramNode>()
              {
                new DiagramNode()
                {
                  //Position of the node
                  OffsetX = 100, OffsetY = 100,
                  //Size of the node
                  Width = 100, Height = 100,
                  //unique id of the node
                  Id = "node1",
                  //Defines the type to BPMN and shape to activity
                  Shape = new DiagramShape()
                  {
                    Type = Shapes.Bpmn, BpmnShape = BpmnShapes.Activity,
                    //Sets the activity to subprocess
                    Activity=new DiagramBpmnActivity()
                    {
                      Activity = BpmnActivities.SubProcess,
                      //sets collapsed and ad hoc to true
                      SubProcess = new DiagramBpmnSubProcess()
                      {
                        Collapsed = true,
                        Adhoc = true
                       },
                     }
                    }
                  },
                };
              }

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramBpmnSubProcess.#ctor

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramBpmnSubProcess.Adhoc
member.summary: Specifies whether the subprocess is without any prescribed order or not.

tr.td: Specifies a subprocess is a group of tasks that are executed in any order or skipped to fulfill the end condition and set it with the Ad-hoc property of the subprocess.

member.remarks: The Boundary property of the subprocess allows you to define the type of boundary.

member.summary: Specifies whether the task is triggered as compensation for another task.
member.remarks: Compensation is triggered when the operation is partially failed and enabled it with the compensation property of the task and the subprocess.

member.remarks: Event SubProcess has placed within another subprocess that part of the normal flow of its parent process is not.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramBpmnSubProcess.Transaction
member.summary: Specifies the transaction of the subprocess

tr.td: The transaction is a set of activities that logically belong together that all contained activities must complete their parts of the transaction otherwise, the process is failed. The execution result of a transaction is one of the following.
� Successful Completion.
� Unsuccessful Completion (Cancel).
� Hazard (Exception).

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramBpmnTask
member.summary: This occurs within a process and it is not broken down to a finer level of detail.

example.code:
<SfDiagram Height="600px" Nodes="@NodeCollection">

            @code{
              //Initialize the node collection with node

                new DiagramNode()
                {
                  //Position of the node
                  OffsetX = 100, OffsetY = 100,
                  //Size of the node
                  Width = 100, Height = 100,
                  //Unique Id of the node
                  Id = "node1",
                  //sets the type of shape to Bpmn and shape to activity
                  Shape = new DiagramShape()
                  {
                    Type = Shapes.Bpmn,
                    BpmnShape = BpmnShapes.Activity,
                    //Sets the activity type to task
                    Activity = new DiagramBpmnActivity(){ Activity = BpmnActivities.Task },
                   }
                 }
               };
             }

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramBpmnTransactionSubProcess
member.summary: Specifies the behavior of the BpmnTransactionSubProcess.

tr.td: The transaction is a set of activities that logically belong together that all contained activities must complete their parts of the transaction otherwise, the process is failed. The execution result of a transaction is one of the following
• Successful Completion.
• Unsuccessful Completion (Cancel).
• Hazard (Exception).

example.code:
<SfDiagram Height="600px" Nodes="@NodeCollection">
            </SfDiagram>
            @code {
                //Initialize the node collection with node
                ObservableCollection<DiagramNode> NodeCollection = new ObservableCollection<DiagramNode>()
                {
                  new DiagramNode()
                  {
                    // Position of the node
                    OffsetX = 100, OffsetY = 100,
                    // Size of the node
                    Width = 100, Height = 100,
                    // Unique id of the node
                    Id = "node1",
                    //Defines the type to BPMN and shape to activity
                    Shape = new DiagramShape()
                    {
                      Type = Shapes.Bpmn,
                      BpmnShape = BpmnShapes.Activity,
                      //Sets the activity to subprocess
                      Activity = new DiagramBpmnActivity()
                      {
                        Activity = BpmnActivities.SubProcess,
                        //Sets collapsed to true and type to Transaction
                        SubProcess = new DiagramBpmnSubProcess()
                        {
                          Collapsed = true,
                          Type = BpmnSubProcessTypes.Transaction,
                          //Sets offset and visible for cancel and offset for failure
                          Transaction = new DiagramBpmnTransactionSubProcess()
                          {
                            Cancel = new CancelSubEvent(){ Visible = true, Offset = new BpmnSubEventOffset(){ X = 0.25, Y = 1}},
                            Failure = new FailureSubEvent(){ Offset = new BpmnSubEventOffset(){ X = 0.75, Y = 1}}
                           }
                        },
                       }
                     }
                    }
                  };
               }

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramClassifierMultiplicity
member.summary: Represents the behavior of the UMLActivity Classifier Multiplicity connection defaults.

tr.td: The Multiplicity property in UML allows you to specify a large number of elements or some collection of elements. By default, the multiplicity will be considered as OneToOne. The type of multiplicity is as follows.
1. OneToOne.
2. ManyToOne.
3. OneToMany.
4. ManyToMany.

example.code:
<SfDiagram Height="600px" Nodes="@NodeCollection">
            </SfDiagram>
            @code{
                   //...
                 Shape = new DiagramConnectorShape()
                 {
                     Type = ConnectionShapes.UmlClassifier,
                     //Set a relationship for connector
                     Relationship = ClassifierShape.Dependency,
                     Multiplicity = new DiagramClassifierMultiplicity()
                      {
                        //Set multiplicity type
                        Type = Multiplicity.OneToMany,
                        //Set source label to connector
                        Source = new SourceMultiplicityLabel()
                         {
                           Optional = true,
                           LowerBounds = "89",
                           UpperBounds = "67"
                          },
                          //Set target label to a connector
                          Target = new TargetMultiplicityLabel()
                          {
                            Optional = true,
                            LowerBounds = "78",
                            UpperBounds = "90"
                           }
                      }
                  },       
                 //...
              }

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramClassifierMultiplicity.#ctor
member.summary: Represents the behavior of the UMLActivity Classifier Multiplicity connection defaults.

member.summary: Specifies the source label to a connector.

member.summary: Specifies the target label to a connector.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramClassifierMultiplicity.Type
member.summary: Specifies the type of Classifier multiplicity. By default, it is set to OneToOne.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramConnector
member.summary: A path between two points, like nodes or ports.

tr.td: A connector is a piece of a path in the diagram, connecting two points. The points might be nodes, ports, etc., A connector is created using a source point and a target point. The connector might contain decorators, which distinguish the target point from the source point. A connector can be straight or orthogonal.
The following code demonstrates, how to define the DiagramConnector and its properties.

example.code:
<SfDiagram Height="600px" Connectors="@ConnectorCollection">
            </SfDiagram>
            @code
            {
                //Defines diagram's connector collection
                public ObservableCollection<DiagramConnector> ConnectorCollection = new ObservableCollection<DiagramConnector>();
                protected override void OnInitialized()
                {
                  DiagramConnector DiagramConnector = new DiagramConnector()
                   {
                     // Set the source and target point of the connector
                     SourcePoint = new ConnectorSourcePoint() { X = 100, Y = 100 },
                     TargetPoint = new ConnectorTargetPoint() { X = 200, Y = 200 },
                     // Type of the connector segemnts
                     Type = Segments.Straight,
                   };
                   //Add the connector into connectors' collection.
                   ConnectorCollection.Add(DiagramConnector);
                 }
             }

member.summary: Represents the objects used to create link between two points, nodes or ports to represent the relationships between them.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramConnector.#ctor
member.summary: A path between two points, like nodes or ports.

member.remarks: At points of intersection, line bridging creates a bridge to crossover the other connectors. The bridgeSpace defines the width for line bridging. However, Beizer does not support line bridging. Bridging can be enabled by including the “DiagramConstraints.Bridging” constraint.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramConnectorAnnotation
member.summary: Represents the block of text displayed over the connector.
member.remarks: Annotation is used to present some textual data for the connector which can be edited at runtime. Multiple annotations can be added to the connector. Users can able to modify the annotation style, visibility, width, height, and content of the annotation through code or visually.

example.code:
<SfDiagram Height="600px" Connectors="@ConnectorCollection">   
            </SfDiagram>
            @code 
            { 
             //Defines diagram's connector collection
             public ObservableCollection<DiagramConnector> ConnectorCollection { get; set; }
             protected override void OnInitialized()
             {
                ConnectorCollection = new ObservableCollection<DiagramConnector>();
                DiagramConnector Connector = new DiagramConnector()
               {
                  SourcePoint = new ConnectorSourcePoint() { X = 300, Y = 40 },
                  TargetPoint = new ConnectorTargetPoint() { X = 400, Y = 160 },
                  Type = Segments.Orthogonal,
                  Style = new ConnectorShapeStyle()
                  {StrokeColor = "#6BA5D7”},
                  Annotations = new ObservableCollection<DiagramConnectorAnnotation>()
                  {
                    //An annotation is created and stored in the Annotation collection of the connector.
                    new DiagramConnectorAnnotation () {Content = "Annotation" }
                  }
                };
                ConnectorCollection.Add(Connector);
               }
             }

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramConnectorAnnotation.#ctor
member.summary: Represents the block of text displayed over the connector.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramConnectorAnnotation.AddInfo
member.summary: Specifies the additional information about annotation.
member.remarks: Enables the user to store data of any datatype. It will be serialized and deserialized automatically while saving and opening the diagram.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramConnectorAnnotation.Alignment
member.summary: Specifies the position of the label based on the segment alignment.

tr.td: Specifies the position of the label based on the segment alignment.
1. Center - Aligns the annotation at the center of a connector segment.
2. Before - Aligns the annotation before a connector segment.
3. After - Aligns the annotation after a connector segment.
By default, the alignment is set as the center.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramConnectorAnnotation.AnnotationType
member.summary: This property allows the users to define a type of annotation template.

tr.td: The following values can be set for the value of the Annotation.
1. String - Annotation template to be in the string.
2. Template - Annotation template to be in HTML Content.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramConnectorAnnotation.Constraints
member.summary: The constraints property allows the user to enable or disable certain behaviors of the label. For instance, the user can disable annotation editing and able to make it as read-only.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramConnectorAnnotation.Content
member.summary: Gets or sets the textual description of the connector.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramConnectorAnnotation.Displacement
member.summary: The Displacement property allows the user to dislocate the annotation from its original place by the given value.
member.remarks: By default, the annotation will be in the center of the connector path. When the user assigns value to the Displacement property, the annotation will be displaced from its position by displacement value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramConnectorAnnotation.DragLimit
member.summary: This property allows the user to limit the dragging of connector label to a certain distance. By default, it is set to 20 from all sides.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramConnectorAnnotation.Height
member.summary: Gets or sets the height of the annotations.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramConnectorAnnotation.HorizontalAlignment
member.summary: Describes how an annotation element is horizontally positioned or stretched within a connector. the characteristics of its immediate parent

tr.td: The list of following options is used to defining the Horizontal Alignment of the annotation
1. Stretch - Stretches the diagram element throughout the connector
2. Left - Aligns the diagram element at the left of the connector
3. Right - Aligns the diagram element at the right of the connector
4. Center - Aligns the diagram element at the center of the connector
5. Auto - Aligns the diagram element based on the characteristics of the connector
By default, HorizontalAlignment is set to center.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramConnectorAnnotation.Hyperlink
member.summary: This property allows the user to add a hyperlink to the connector label.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramConnectorAnnotation.Id
member.summary: Returns the unique id of an Annotation.
member.remarks: Annotation Id needs to be unique to use. When creating a label, the user should not provide the same id to other labels.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramConnectorAnnotation.Margin
member.summary: Specifies the space around the annotation content. The default values for the Margin are set to 0 from all sides.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramConnectorAnnotation.Offset
member.summary: Specifies the position of the label relative to the bounds of the connector. The default value for offset is set to 0.5.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramConnectorAnnotation.RotateAngle
member.summary: Gets or sets the rotation angle of the label.
member.remarks: Connector labels can be rotated either by code-behind or mouse interaction. By default, the rotate angle will be 0.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramConnectorAnnotation.SegmentAngle
member.summary: This property allows the user to rotate the annotation based on the connector segment direction.
member.remarks: By default, the annotation will be rotated in the connector path. When the user assigns value to the SegmentPath property, the annotation will be rotated from its position based on the connector segment direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramConnectorAnnotation.Style
member.summary: Defines the appearance of the text
member.remarks: Users can change the font style of the label with the font specific properties such as font family, font size, font color, bold, etc., The fill and border appearances of the text can also be customized with appearance specific properties of label such as fill color, border color, etc.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramConnectorAnnotation.Template
member.summary: This property represents the template’s content of the label. The User can define any HTML content as a template.
member.remarks: Users can set the label content as a template instead of textual content or hyperlink, by using template property. For that SVG or HTML content should be defined as a string in an annotation’s template property. By default, it is undefined.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramConnectorAnnotation.Type
member.summary: This property is used to define the positioning behavior of the annotation. It can be either “Shape” or “Path”.

tr.td: The following values can be set for the Type property of the annotation,
1. shape - sets the annotation type to shape.
2. Path – sets the annotation type to the path.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramConnectorAnnotation.VerticalAlignment
member.summary: Describes how an annotation element is vertically positioned or stretched within a connector.

tr.td: The list of following options is used to defining the vertical alignment of the annotation,
1. Top - Aligns the diagram element at the top of the connector.
2. Bottom - Aligns the diagram element at the bottom of the connector.
3. Center - Aligns the diagram element at the center of the connector.
4. Auto - Aligns the diagram element based on the characteristics of the connector.
By default, VerticalAlignment is set to center.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramConnectorAnnotation.Visibility
member.summary: specifies the visibility of the annotation.
member.remarks: By default, visibility is set to true. If the visibility is false, then the connector annotation will not be visible.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramConnectorAnnotation.Width
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of an annotation.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramConnectorSegment
member.summary: Specifies the collection connector segment that may have types like Straight, Orthogonal, Beizer.
member.remarks: The connector segment can be customized as per the user’s perception. The available connector segment types are Straight, Orthogonal, Beizer.

example.code:
<SfDiagram Connectors="@ConnectorCollection">
            </SfDiagram>
            @code
            {
              public ObservableCollection<DiagramConnector> ConnectorCollection = new ObservableCollection<DiagramConnector>();
              protected override void OnInitialized()
             {
                DiagramConnector DiagramConnector = new DiagramConnector()
                {
                   SourcePoint = new ConnectorSourcePoint() { X = 100, Y = 200 },
                   TargetPoint = new ConnectorTargetPoint() { X = 300, Y = 200 },
                   Segments = new ObservableCollection<DiagramConnectorSegment>()
                  {
                    //Create a new segment with length and direction
                    new DiagramConnectorSegment()
                    {
                      Length = 100,
                      Type = Segments.Orthogonal,
                      Direction = Direction.Right,
                    },
                 }
                };
               ConnectorCollection.Add(DiagramConnector);
              }
             }

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramConnectorSegment.#ctor
member.summary: Defines the type of segment. To create a connector segment, specify the source point and target point. Hence a connector of Straight type is formed.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramConnectorSegment.AllowDrag
member.summary: Defines whether the connector can be draggable or not.
member.remarks: AllowDrag is of type Boolean. By default, AllowDrag is true. All the connectors are draggable unless the AllowDrag of it is set to false.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramConnectorSegment.Direction
member.summary: Sets the direction of the orthogonal segment
member.remarks: By default, the value of the Direction is null. The Direction of the connector segment can be set to Top, Left, Bottom, or Right.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramConnectorSegment.Length
member.summary: Sets the length of the orthogonal connector segment.
member.remarks: By default, the value of Length is 0 and it is applicable only for the orthogonal segment.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramConnectorSegment.Point
member.summary: Sets the control point of the Bezier segment.
member.remarks: It applies only to the Bezier segment.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramConnectorSegment.Point1
member.summary: Sets the first control point of the connector segment

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramConnectorSegment.Point2
member.summary: Sets the second control point of the connector segment

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramConnectorSegment.Type
member.summary: Defines the type of connector segment.
member.remarks: The connector segments can be of Orthogonal, Straight, Beizer types.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramConnectorSegment.Vector1
member.summary: Defines the length and angle between the source point and the first control point
member.remarks: It applies only to the Bezier segment.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramConnectorSegment.Vector2
member.summary: Defines the length and angle between the target point and the second control point.
member.remarks: It applies only to the Bezier segment.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramConnectorShape
member.summary: Defines the shape of the connector.

example.code:
<SfDiagram Connectors="@ConnectorCollection">
            </SfDiagram>
            @code
            {
             public ObservableCollection<DiagramConnector> ConnectorCollection = new ObservableCollection<DiagramConnector>();
             protected override void OnInitialized()
             {
                DiagramConnector DiagramConnector = new DiagramConnector()
                {
                  SourcePoint = new ConnectorSourcePoint() { X = 100, Y = 200 },
                  TargetPoint = new ConnectorTargetPoint() { X = 300, Y = 200 },
                  //Sets the type to Bpmn, flow to Association and association to bidirectional
                  Shape = new DiagramConnectorShape()
                  {
                    Type = ConnectionShapes.Bpmn,
                    BpmnFlow = BpmnFlows.Association,
                    Association = BpmnAssociationFlows.Directional
                  }
                };
               ConnectorCollection.Add(DiagramConnector);
             }

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramConnectorShape.#ctor
member.summary: Defines the shape of the connector.

member.summary: Sets the BPMN Flow Type as Association.
member.remarks: The diagram connector shape can be set to the association by setting the BPMNFlow property to the association. Types of the association are Directional, BiDirectional, Default.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramConnectorShape.AssociationType
member.summary: Defines the type of connector shape.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramConnectorShape.BpmnFlow
member.summary: It defines whether the connector can act as a normal connector or BPMN flow.
member.remarks: The BPMNFlow can be set to Association, Sequence, or Message.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramConnectorShape.ExceptionFlowHeight

member.remarks: By default, the value of ExceptionHeightFlow is 50.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramConnectorShape.Message

member.remarks: The BPMN Flow Type can be set to Message. The types of message flow are Initiating, NonInitiating, and Default.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramConnectorShape.Multiplicity

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramConnectorShape.Relationship

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramConnectorShape.Sequence
member.summary: The sequence flow represents a solid graphic flow segment
member.remarks: This sets the BPMN Flow Type as Sequence. The types of sequences are Normal, Conditional, and Default.

member.remarks: The connector shape can be set to None, BPMN, UMLActivity or UMLClassifier.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramContextMenuSettings
member.summary: It is a built-in menu loaded with few features which open when right-clicked.

example.code:
<SfDiagram @ref="@Diagram" Nodes="@NodeCollection">
            // Defines context menu and set the ShowCustomMenuOnly to false to render the custom context menu along with the default context menu
            <DiagramContextMenuSettings Show = "true" Items="@ContextMenuItemModels" >
            </DiagramContextMenuSettings>
            </SfDiagram>
            @code
            {
             //Reference to diagram
             SfDiagram Diagram;
             //Defines diagram's nodes collection
             public ObservableCollection<DiagramNode> NodeCollection = new ObservableCollection<DiagramNode>();
             protected override void OnInitialized()
             {
                //Create a node
                DiagramNode Node = new DiagramNode()
                {
                  OffsetX = 100,
                  OffsetY = 100,
                  Height = 100,
                  Width = 100,
                  Id = "node1",
                };
                //Add node into node's collection
                NodeCollection.Add(Node);
              }
              // Add the custom context menu items
              List<ContextMenuItemModel> ContextMenuItemModels = new List<ContextMenuItemModel>()
              {
              new ContextMenuItemModel()
              {
                 Text ="color",
                 Id="Save",
                  Target =".e-elementcontent",
                  // Add the nested custom context menu items
                 Items = new List<ContextMenuItemModel>()
               {
                new ContextMenuItemModel(){  Text ="Red", Id="Red", },
                new ContextMenuItemModel(){  Text ="Yellow", Id="Yellow", },
                new ContextMenuItemModel(){  Text ="Green", Id="Green", }
                }
                },
              };
             }

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramContextMenuSettings._jsNamespace
member.summary: It is a built-in menu loaded with few features which open when right-clicked.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramContextMenuSettings.Show
member.summary: Defines whether to enable or disable the context menu.
member.remarks: By default, the Show is set to false. The context menu can be enabled by setting the Show to true.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramContextMenuSettings.ShowCustomMenuOnly

member.remarks: By default, the ShowCustomMenuOnly is set to false. The context menu can be enabled by setting the ShowCustomMenuOnly to true.

example.code:
<SfDiagram>
              // Define custom menu  <DiagramContextMenuSettings ShowCustomMenuOnly="true">    
            </DiagramContextMenuSettings></SfDiagram>

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramDecorator
member.summary: Represents the connector's start and endpoint decorations.
member.remarks: The connector's start and endpoints can be decorated with some customizable shapes such as arrows, circles, diamonds, or path. The start and endpoint of the connector can be decorated with the connector 's source decorator and target decorator properties. The following code shows how the target decorator and its property should be defined.

example.code:
<SfDiagram Height="600px" Connectors="@ConnectorCollection">
            </SfDiagram>
            @code
            {
                //Defines diagram's connector collection
                public ObservableCollection<DiagramConnector> ConnectorCollection = new ObservableCollection<DiagramConnector>();
                protected override void OnInitialized()
                {
                  DiagramConnector DiagramConnector = new DiagramConnector()
                    {
                     SourcePoint = new ConnectorSourcePoint() { X = 100, Y = 100 },
                     TargetPoint = new ConnectorTargetPoint() { X = 200, Y = 200 },
                     TargetDecorator = new ConnectorTargetDecorator()
                     {
                      Shape = DecoratorShapes.Arrow,
                      Style = new DecoratorShapeStyle() { Fill = "#6f409f", StrokeColor = "#6f409f", StrokeWidth = 1 }
                      },
                       Style = new ConnectorShapeStyle() { StrokeColor = "#6f409f", StrokeWidth = 1 },
                       //Specify the segment types as straight.
                       Type = Segments.Straight,
                      };
                      ConnectorCollection.Add(DiagramConnector);
                  }
             }

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramDecorator.#ctor
member.summary: Represents the connector's start and endpoint decorations.

member.summary: Defines the shape of the decorator geometry.

member.summary: Specifies the position (X, Y) of the decorator to the source or target point of the connector. By default, it is set to X=0,Y=0.

member.remarks: Start and endpoints of a connector can be decorated with some customizable shapes like arrows, circles, diamonds, or path.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.DiagramDecorator.Style

member.remarks: Users can customize the appearance of the source or target decorator by using the property such as StrokeColor, Strokewidth, StrokeDashArray, and Fill.
