member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.NodeTooltip.Animation
member.summary: This property allows the user to enable the animation to the tooltip.
member.remarks: To animate the tooltip specific animation effects are available and it can be controlled by Animation property. This property allows the user to set some animation effects such as display, duration, ZoomIn, ZoomOut,etc.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.NodeTooltip.Content
member.summary: Defines the textual content of the tooltip.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.NodeTooltip.Height
member.summary: Gets or sets the height of the tooltip.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.NodeTooltip.OpenOn
member.summary: Specifies whether the tooltip can be open automatically or open manually using public API. By default, its set to Auto.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.NodeTooltip.Position
member.summary: Defines the position of the Tooltip.

tr.td: • Tooltip can be aligned by using the NodeTooltip property.
• There are applicable positions such as TopLeft, TopRight, BottomLeft, BottomRight, etc., where the tooltip can be displayed over the specific target elements.
• By default, the position of the tooltip will be TopLeft.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.NodeTooltip.RelativeMode
member.summary: This property defines whether the tooltip has to displayed around the object or at the mouse position. By default, it will be Mouse.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.NodeTooltip.ShowTipPointer
member.summary: Defines the tooltip has tip pointer or not. By default, it will be true.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.NodeTooltip.Width
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the tooltip.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.ConnectorTooltip
member.summary: Represents the textual content that appears while the mouse is hovering over a connector.

example.code:
<SfDiagram Height="600px" Connectors="@ConnectorCollection">
            </SfDiagram>
            @code
            {
               //Defines diagram's connector collection
               public ObservableCollection<DiagramConnector> ConnectorCollection = new ObservableCollection<DiagramConnector>();
               protected override void OnInitialized()
               {
                DiagramConnector DiagramConnector = new DiagramConnector()
                {
                  SourcePoint = new ConnectorSourcePoint() { X = 100, Y = 100 },
                  TargetPoint = new ConnectorTargetPoint() { X = 200, Y = 200 },
                  //Specify the segments types as straight.
                  Type = Segments.Straight,
                  Constraints = ConnectorConstraints.Default | ConnectorConstraints.Tooltip,
                  //Defines mouse over tooltip for a connector
                  Tooltip = new ConnectorTooltip()
                  {
                    //Sets the content of the tooltip
                    Content = "Connector1",
                    //Sets the position of the tooltip
                    Position = Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.Position.BottomRight,
                    //Sets the tooltip position relative to the connector
                    RelativeMode = TooltipRelativeMode.Object
                  }
                };
               ConnectorCollection.Add(DiagramConnector);
              }
             }

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.PortShapeStyle
member.summary: Represents the appearance of the port.

example.code:
<SfDiagram Height="600px" Nodes="@NodeCollection">
            </SfDiagram>
             @code{
               public ObservableCollection<DiagramNode> NodeCollection = new ObservableCollection<DiagramNode>() { };
               protected override void OnInitialized()
               {
                // A node is created and stored in nodes collection.
                DiagramNode Node = new DiagramNode()
                {
                    // Position of the node
                    OffsetX = 250,
                    OffsetY = 250,
                    // Size of the node
                    Width = 100,
                    Height = 100,
                    Style = new NodeShapeStyle() { Fill = "#6BA5D7", StrokeColor = "white" },
                    // Initialize port collection
                    Ports = new ObservableCollection<DiagramPort>() {
                    new DiagramPort() {
                       Id = "port1",
                       Offset = new NodePortOffset(){X= 0.5, Y= 0.5 }, Visibility = PortVisibility.Visible,
                       //Set the style for the port
                       Style=new PortShapeStyle(){ Fill="red" , Opacity = 1,
                       StrokeColor= "black", StrokeWidth= 1, StrokeDashArray= "2,2"},
                     }
                    },
                  };
                  NodeCollection.Add(Node);
               }
             }

• LinearGradient

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.SourceMultiplicityLabel
member.summary: Specifies the source label to the connector.

example.code:
<SfDiagram  Height="600px" Connectors="@ConnectorCollection">
            </SfDiagram>
            @code{
               ///Defines diagram's connector collection
               public ObservableCollection<DiagramConnector> ConnectorCollection { get; set; }
               protected override void OnInitialized()
               {
                   ConnectorCollection = new ObservableCollection<DiagramConnector>();
                   DiagramConnector Connector = new DiagramConnector()
                   {
                       Id = "Connector1",
                       Type = Segments.Straight,
                       Shape = new DiagramConnectorShape()
                       {
                           Type = ConnectionShapes.UmlClassifier,
                           //Set an relationship for connector
                           Relationship = ClassifierShape.Dependency,
                           Multiplicity = new DiagramClassifierMultiplicity()
                           {
                               //Set multiplicity type
                               Type = Multiplicity.OneToMany,
                               //Set source label to connector
                               Source = new SourceMultiplicityLabel()
                               {
                                   Optional = true,
                                   LowerBounds = "89",
                                   UpperBounds = "67"
                               },
                               //Set target label to a connector
                               Target = new TargetMultiplicityLabel()
                               {
                                   Optional = true,
                                   LowerBounds = "78",
                                   UpperBounds = "90"
                               }
                           }
                       },
                       //Define connector start and endpoints
                       SourcePoint = new ConnectorSourcePoint() { X = 100, Y = 100 },
                       TargetPoint = new ConnectorTargetPoint() { X = 300, Y = 300 }
                   };
                   ConnectorCollection.Add(Connector);
               }
            }

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.SourceMultiplicityLabel.#ctor
member.summary: Specifies the source label to the connector.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.SourceMultiplicityLabel.LowerBounds
member.summary: Defines the minimum bounds of the Classifier Multiplicity. Lower bounds should be lesser than upper bounds.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.SourceMultiplicityLabel.Optional
member.summary: Defines the optionality for the connector source label. By default, It`s set to true.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.SourceMultiplicityLabel.UpperBounds
member.summary: Defines the maximum bounds of the Classifier Multiplicity. Upper bounds should be greater than or equal to Lower bounds.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.SuccessSubEvent
member.summary: Represents the event within another subprocess.

example.code:
<SfDiagram Height="600px" Nodes="@NodeCollection">
            </SfDiagram>
            @code {
               //Initialize the node collection with node
               ObservableCollection<DiagramNode> NodeCollection = new ObservableCollection<DiagramNode>()
               {
                   new DiagramNode()
                   {
                       // Position of the node
                       OffsetX = 100, OffsetY = 100,
                       // Size of the node
                       Width = 100, Height = 100,
                       // Unique id of the node
                       Id = "node1",
                       //Defines the type to BPMN and shape to activity
                       Shape = new DiagramShape()
                       {
                           Type = Shapes.Bpmn,
                           BpmnShape = BpmnShapes.Activity,
                           //Sets the activity to subprocess
                           Activity = new DiagramBpmnActivity()
                           {
                               Activity = BpmnActivities.SubProcess,
                               //Sets collapsed to true and type to Transaction
                               SubProcess = new DiagramBpmnSubProcess()
                               {
                                   Collapsed = true,
                                   Type = BpmnSubProcessTypes.Transaction,
                                   //Sets offset and visible for cancel and offset for failure
                                   Transaction = new DiagramBpmnTransactionSubProcess()
                                   {
                                       Success = new SuccessSubEvent(){ Visible = true, Offset = new BpmnSubEventOffset(){ X = 0.25, Y = 1}},
                                   }
                               },
                           }
                       }
                   }
               };
            }

               }

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.FloatLabelType
member.summary:
Specifies the floating label behavior of the DropDownList that the placeholder text floats above the DropDownList based on the following values.
Possible values are:
Never Never floats the label in the DropDownList when the placeholder is available.
Always The floating label always floats above the DropDownList.
Auto The floating label floats above the DropDownList after focusing it or when enters the value in it.

The filter action retrieves matched items through the `Filtering` event based on the characters typed in the search TextBox.

member.summary: Accepts the value to be displayed as a watermark text on the filter bar.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.DropDownListModel`2.FloatLabelType
member.summary:
Specifies the floating label behavior of the DropDownList that the placeholder text floats above the DropDownList based on the following values.
Possible values are:
Never Never floats the label in the DropDownList when the placeholder is available.
Always The floating label always floats above the DropDownList.
Auto The floating label floats above the DropDownList after focusing it or when enters the value in it.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.DropDownListModel`2.FooterTemplate
member.summary: Accepts the template design and assigns it to the footer container of the popup list.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.DropDownListModel`2.HeaderTemplate
member.summary: Accepts the template design and assigns it to the header container of the popup list.

member.summary:

If you configured both the property and equivalent input attribute, then the component considers the property value.

member.summary: Gets or sets the index of the selected item in the component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.DropDownListModel`2.Placeholder
member.summary: Specifies the text that is shown as a hint or placeholder until the user focuses or enter a value in DropDownList. The property is depending on the FloatLabelType property.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.DropDownListModel`2.PopupHeight
member.summary: Specifies the height of the popup list.

member.summary: Specifies the width of the popup list. By default, the popup width sets based on the width of the component.

member.summary: Specifies the boolean value whether the DropDownList allows the user to change the value.

summary.para: Accepts the list items either through local or remote service and binds it to the component.
It can be an array of JSON Objects or an instance of `DataManager`.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.DropDownListModel`2.ActionFailureTemplate
member.summary: Accepts the template and assigns it to the popup list content of the component when the data fetch request from the remote server fails.

summary.para: Specifies whether to show or hide the clear button.
When the clear button is clicked, `Value`, `Text`, and `Index` properties are reset to null.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.DropDownListModel`2.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the display text of the selected item in the component.

member.summary: Gets or sets the value of the selected item in the component.

member.summary: Accepts the template design and assigns it to the selected list item in the input element of the component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.DropDownListModel`2.Width
member.summary:
Specifies the width of the component. By default, the component width sets based on the width of its parent container.
You can also set the width in pixel values.

summary.para: To enable the filtering option in this component.
Filter action performs when type in search box and collect the matched item through `Filtering` event.
If searching character does not match, `NoRecordsTemplate` property value will be shown.
By default, the MultiSelect component fires the Change event while focus out the component.
If you want to fires the Change event on every value selection and remove, then disable the ChangeOnBlur property.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.MultiSelectModel`1.ClosePopupOnSelect
member.summary: Based on the property, when item get select popup visibility state will changed.

member.summary: Specifies the CSS class name that can be appended with the root element of the MultiSelect. One or more custom CSS classes can be added to a MultiSelect.

summary.para: Accepts the list items either through local or remote service and binds it to the MultiSelect component.

member.summary: Sets the delimiter character for 'default' and 'delimiter' visibility modes.

summary.para: Specifies a boolean value that indicates the whether the grouped list items are allowed to check by checking the group header in checkbox mode.
By default, there is no checkbox provided for group headers.
This property allows you to render checkbox for group headers and to select all the grouped items at once.
Enable or disable persisting MultiSelect state between page reloads.
If enabled, the `Value` state will be persisted.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.MultiSelectModel`1.FloatLabelType
member.summary:
Specifies the floating label behavior of the MultiSelect that the placeholder text floats above the MultiSelect based on the following values.
Possible values are:
Never Never floats the label in the MultiSelect when the placeholder is available.
Always The floating label always floats above the MultiSelect.
Auto The floating label floats above the MultiSelect after focusing it or when enters the value in it.

summary.para: To enable the filtering option in this component.
Filter action performs when type in search box and collect the matched item through `Filtering` event.
If searching character does not match, `NoRecordsTemplate` property value will be shown.
By default, the MultiSelect component fires the Change event while focus out the component.
If you want to fires the Change event on every value selection and remove, then disable the ChangeOnBlur property.

Possible values are:
Never Never floats the label in the TextBox when the placeholder is available.
Always The floating label always floats above the TextBox.
Auto The floating label floats above the TextBox after focusing it or when enters the value in it.

member.summary: Specifies the CSS class name that can be appended with the root element of the MaskedTextBox. One or more custom CSS classes can be added to a MaskedTextBox.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.MaskedTextBoxModel.CustomCharacters
member.summary:
Sets the collection of values to be mapped for non-mask elements(literals) which have been set in the mask of MaskedTextBox.
In the below example, non-mask elements "P" accepts values "P" , "A" , "p" , "a" and "M" accepts values "M", "m" mentioned in the custom characters collection.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.MaskedTextBoxModel.EnablePersistence
member.summary: Enable or disable persisting MaskedTextBox state between page reloads. If enabled, the `Value` state will be persisted.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.MaskedTextBoxModel.EnableRtl
member.summary: Enable or disable rendering MaskedTextBox in right to left direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.MaskedTextBoxModel.Enabled
member.summary: Specifies a boolean value that indicates whether the MaskedTextBox allows the user to interact with it.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.MaskedTextBoxModel.FloatLabelType
member.summary:
Specifies the floating label behavior of the MaskedTextBox that the placeholder text floats above the MaskedTextBox based on the below values.
Possible values are:
Never Never floats the label in the MaskedTextBox when the placeholder is available.
Always The floating label always floats above the MaskedTextBox.
Auto The floating label floats above the MaskedTextBox after focusing it or when enters the value in it.

summary.para: You can add the additional html attributes such as styles, class, and more to the root element.
If you configured both property and equivalent html attributes, then the MaskedTextBox considers the property value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.MaskedTextBoxModel.Locale
member.summary: Specifies the global culture and localization of the MaskedTextBox component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.MaskedTextBoxModel.Mask
member.summary: Sets a value that masks the MaskedTextBox to allow or validate the user input. If the Mask value is empty, the MaskedTextBox will behave as an input element with text type.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.MaskedTextBoxModel.Placeholder
member.summary: Specifies the text that is shown as a hint or placeholder until the user focuses or enter a value in MaskedTextBox. The property is depending on the FloatLabelType property.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.MaskedTextBoxModel.PromptChar
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that will be shown as a prompting symbol for the masked value. The symbol used to show input positions in the MaskedTextBox.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.MaskedTextBoxModel.Readonly
member.summary: Specifies a boolean value whether the MaskedTextBox allows user to change the text.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.MaskedTextBoxModel.ShowClearButton
member.summary: Specifies whether to show or hide the clear icon.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.MaskedTextBoxModel.Value
member.summary:
Gets or sets the value of the MaskedTextBox. It is a raw value of the MaskedTextBox excluding literals and prompt characters.
By using `GetMaskedValue` property, you can get the value of MaskedTextBox with the masked format.

member.summary: Specifies the width of the MaskedTextBox component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SliderModel`1.Type
member.summary: Defines the type of the Slider. The available options are: default - Allows to a single value in the Slider. minRange - Allows to select a single value in the Slider. It display’s a shadow from the start to the current value. range - Allows to select a range of values in the Slider. It displays shadow in-between the selection range. {% codeBlock src='slider/types/index.md' %}{% endcodeBlock %}

member.summary: It is used to denote the position for the tooltip element in the Slider. member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.TooltipDataModel.ShowOn
member.summary: It is used to determine the device mode to show the Tooltip. If it is in desktop, it will show the Tooltip content when hovering on the target element. If it is in touch device. It will show the Tooltip content when tap and holding on the target element. {% codeBlock src='slider/tooltipShowOn/index.md' %}{% endcodeBlock %}

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.AsyncSettingsModel
member.summary: Interface for a class AsyncSettings

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.AsyncSettingsModel.ChunkSize
member.summary:
Specifies the chunk size to split the large file into chunks, and upload it to the server in a sequential order.
If the ChunkSize property has value, the Uploader enables the chunk upload by default.
It must be specified in bytes value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.AsyncSettingsModel.RemoveUrl
member.summary:
Specifies the URL of remove action that receives the file information and handle the remove operation in server.
The remove action type must be POST request and define "RemoveFileNames" attribute to get file information that will be removed.
This property is optional.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.AsyncSettingsModel.RetryAfterDelay
member.summary: Specifies the delay time in milliseconds that the automatic retry happens after the delay.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.AsyncSettingsModel.RetryCount
member.summary: Specifies the number of retries that the Uploader can perform on the file failed to upload. By default, the Uploader set 3 as maximum retries. This property must be specified to prevent infinity looping.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.AsyncSettingsModel.SaveUrl
member.summary:
Specifies the URL of save action that will receive the upload files and save in the server.
The save action type must be POST request and define the argument as same input name used to render the component.
The upload operations could not perform without this property.

member.summary: Fires if the chunk file failed to upload.

member.summary: Fires when the chunk file uploaded successfully.

member.summary: Triggers before clearing the items in file list when clicking "clear".

member.summary: Triggers when the Uploader is created.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderModel.Failure
member.summary: Triggers when the AJAX request fails on uploading or removing files.

member.summary: Triggers before rendering each file item from the file list in a page. It helps to customize specific file item structure.

member.summary: Fires if pause the chunk file uploading.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderModel.Progress
member.summary: Triggers when uploading a file to the server using the AJAX request.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderModel.Removing
member.summary: Triggers on removing the uploaded file. The event used to get confirm before removing the file from server.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderModel.Rendering
member.summary: DEPRECATED-Triggers before rendering each file item from the file list in a page. It helps to customize specific file item structure.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderModel.Resuming
member.summary: Fires if resume the paused chunk file upload.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderModel.Selected
member.summary: Triggers after selecting or dropping the files by adding the files in upload queue.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderModel.Success
member.summary: Triggers when the AJAX request gets success on uploading files or removing files.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderModel.Uploading
member.summary: Triggers when the upload process gets started. This event is used to add additional parameter with upload request.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderModel.AllowedExtensions
member.summary:
Specifies the extensions of the file types allowed in the Uploader component and pass the extensions with comma separators.
For example,if you want to upload specific image files, pass `AllowedExtensions` as ".jpg,.png".

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderModel.AsyncSettings
member.summary: Configures the save and remove URL to perform the upload operations in the server asynchronously.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderModel.AutoUpload
member.summary:
By default, the Uploader component initiates automatic upload when the files are added in upload queue.
If you want to manipulate the files before uploading to server, disable the AutoUpload property.
The buttons "upload" and "clear" will be hided from file list when AutoUpload property is true.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderModel.Buttons
member.summary:
You can customize the default text of "browse, clear, and upload" buttons with plain text or HTML elements. The buttons' text can be customized from localization also.
If you configured both `Locale` and `Buttons` property,the Uploader component considers the `Buttons` property value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderModel.CssClass
member.summary: Specifies the CSS class name that can be appended with root element of the Uploader. One or more custom CSS classes can be added to a Uploader.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderModel.DirectoryUpload
member.summary: Specifies a boolean value that indicates whether the folder of files can be browsed in the Uploader component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderModel.DropArea
member.summary: Specifies the drop target to handle the drag-and-drop upload. By default, the Uploader creates wrapper around file input that will act as drop target.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderModel.DropEffect
member.summary:
Specifies the drag operation effect to the Uploader component.
Possible values are
Copy
Move
Link
None

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderModel.EnablePersistence
member.summary: Enable or disable persisting Uploader state between page reloads. If enabled, the `Files` state will be persisted.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderModel.EnableRtl
member.summary: Enable or disable rendering Uploader in right to left direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderModel.Enabled
member.summary: Specifies a boolean value that indicates whether the Uploader allows the user to interact with it.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderModel.Files
member.summary:
Specifies the list of files that will be preloaded on rendering of Uploader component. The property used to view and remove the uploaded files from server.
By default, the files are configured with uploaded successfully state. The following properties are mandatory to configure the preload files:
Name
Size
Type

summary.para: You can add the additional html attributes such as styles, class, and more to the root element.
If you configured both property and equivalent html attributes, then the Uploader considers the property value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderModel.Locale
member.summary: Specifies the global culture and localization of the Uploader component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderModel.MaxFileSize
member.summary: Specifies the maximum allowed file size to be uploaded in bytes. The property used to make sure that you cannot upload too large files.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderModel.MinFileSize
member.summary: Specifies the minimum file size to be uploaded in bytes. The property used to make sure that you cannot upload empty files and small files.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderModel.Multiple
member.summary: Specifies a boolean value that indicates whether the multiple files can be browsed or dropped simultaneously in the Uploader component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderModel.SequentialUpload
member.summary:
By default, the file Uploader component is processing the multiple files simultaneously.
If SequentialUpload property is enabled, the file upload component performs the upload one after the other.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderModel.ShowFileList
member.summary: Specifies a boolean value that indicates whether the default file list can be rendered. The property used to prevent default file list and design own template for file list.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderModel.Template
member.summary: Specifies the HTML string that used to customize the content of each file in the list.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.NumericTextBoxModel`1.Currency
member.summary: Specifies the currency code to use in currency formatting. Possible values are the ISO 4217 currency codes, such as 'USD' for the US dollar and 'EUR' for the euro.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.NumericTextBoxModel`1.Decimals
member.summary: Specifies the number precision applied to the textbox value when the NumericTextBox is focused.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.NumericTextBoxModel`1.EnablePersistence
member.summary: Enable or disable persisting NumericTextBox state between page reloads. If enabled, the `Value` state will be persisted.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.NumericTextBoxModel`1.EnableRtl
member.summary: Enable or disable rendering component in right to left direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.NumericTextBoxModel`1.Enabled
member.summary: Specifies a boolean value that indicates whether the NumericTextBox allows the user to interact with it.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.NumericTextBoxModel`1.FloatLabelType
member.summary:
Specifies the floating label behavior of the NumericTextBox that the placeholder text floats above the NumericTextBox based on the below values.
Possible values are:
Never Never floats the label in the NumericTextBox when the placeholder is available.
Always The floating label always floats above the NumericTextBox.
Auto The floating label floats above the NumericTextBox after focusing it or when enters the value in it.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.NumericTextBoxModel`1.Format
member.summary: Specifies the number format that indicates the display format for the value of the NumericTextBox.

summary.para: You can add the additional html attributes such as styles, class, and more to the root element.
If you configured both property and equivalent html attributes, then the component considers the property value.
You can add the additional input attributes such as disabled, value, and more to the root element.
If you configured both property and equivalent input attribute, then the component considers the property value.

member.summary: Specifies the global culture and localization of the NumericTextBox component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.NumericTextBoxModel`1.Step
member.summary: Specifies the incremental or decremental step size for the NumericTextBox.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.NumericTextBoxModel`1.StrictMode
member.summary:
Specifies a value that indicates whether the NumericTextBox component allows the value for the specified range.
True- the input value will be restricted between the min and max range. The typed value gets modified to fit the range on a focused out state.
Else, it allows any value even out of range value, at that time of wrong value entered, the error class will be added to the component to highlight the error.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.NumericTextBoxModel`1.ValidateDecimalOnType
member.summary: Specifies whether the length of the decimal should be restricted during typing.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfSlider`1.Type
member.summary: Defines the type of the Slider. The available options are: default - Allows to a single value in the Slider. minRange - Allows to select a single value in the Slider. It display’s a shadow from the start to the current value. range - Allows to select a range of values in the Slider. It displays shadow in-between the selection range. {% codeBlock src='slider/types/index.md' %}{% endcodeBlock %}

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.TextBoxModel
member.summary: Interface for a class TextBox

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.TextBoxModel.Autocomplete
member.summary:
Specifies whether the browser is allowed to automatically enter or select a value for the TextBox.
By default, autocomplete is enabled for TextBox.
Possible values are:
On Specifies that autocomplete is enabled
Off Specifies that autocomplete is disabled.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.TextBoxModel.CssClass
member.summary: Specifies the CSS class name that can be appended with the root element of the TextBox. One or more custom CSS classes can be added to a TextBox.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.TextBoxModel.EnablePersistence
member.summary: Enable or disable the persisting TextBox state between page reloads. If enabled, the `Value` state will be persisted.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.TextBoxModel.EnableRtl
member.summary: Enable or disable rendering component in the right to left direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.TextBoxModel.Enabled
member.summary: Specifies a boolean value that indicates whether the TextBox allows the user to interact with it.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.TextBoxModel.FloatLabelType
member.summary:
Specifies the floating label behavior of the TextBox that the placeholder text floats above the TextBox based on the following values.
Possible values are:
Never Never floats the label in the TextBox when the placeholder is available.
Always The floating label always floats above the TextBox.
Auto The floating label floats above the TextBox after focusing it or when enters the value in it.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.TextBoxModel.HtmlAttributes
member.summary:
You can add the additional html attributes such as styles, class, and more to the root element.
If you configured both property and equivalent html attributes, then the component considers the property value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.TextBoxModel.InputAttributes
member.summary:
You can add the additional input attributes such as disabled, value, and more to the root element.
If you configured both property and equivalent input attribute, then the component considers the property value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.TextBoxModel.Locale
member.summary: Specifies the global culture and localization of the TextBox component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.TextBoxModel.Multiline
member.summary:
Specifies a boolean value that enables or disables the multiline on the TextBox.
The TextBox changes from a single line to multiline when enabling this multiline mode.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.TextBoxModel.Placeholder
member.summary: Specifies the text that is shown as a hint or placeholder until the user focuses or enter a value in TextBox. The property is depending on the FloatLabelType property.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.TextBoxModel.Readonly
member.summary: Specifies the boolean value whether the TextBox allows user to change the text.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.TextBoxModel.ShowClearButton
member.summary: Specifies a boolean value that indicates whether the clear button is displayed in TextBox.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.TextBoxModel.Type
member.summary: Specifies the behavior of the TextBox such as text, password, email, and more.

member.summary: Sets the content of the TextBox.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.ID
member.summary: Specifies the id of the Uploader component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.ChildContent
member.summary: Specifies the content that has to be passed.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.AllowedExtensions
member.summary:
Specifies the extensions of the file types allowed in the Uploader component and pass the extensions with comma separators.
For example,if you want to upload specific image files, pass `AllowedExtensions` as ".jpg,.png".

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.AsyncSettings
member.summary: Configures the save and remove URL to perform the upload operations in the server asynchronously.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.AutoUpload
member.summary:
By default, the Uploader component initiates automatic upload when the files are added in upload queue.
If you want to manipulate the files before uploading to server, disable the AutoUpload property.
The buttons "upload" and "clear" will be hided from file list when AutoUpload property is true.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.Buttons
member.summary:
You can customize the default text of "browse, clear, and upload" buttons with plain text or HTML elements. The buttons' text can be customized from localization also.
If you configured both Locale and Buttons property,the Uploader component considers the Buttons property value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.CssClass
member.summary: Specifies the CSS class name that can be appended with root element of the Uploader. One or more custom CSS classes can be added to a Uploader.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.DirectoryUpload
member.summary: Specifies a boolean value that indicates whether the folder of files can be browsed in the Uploader component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.DropArea
member.summary: Specifies the drop target to handle the drag-and-drop upload. By default, the Uploader creates wrapper around file input that will act as drop target.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.DropEffect
member.summary:
Specifies the drag operation effect to the Uploader component.
Possible values are
Copy
Move
Link
None

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.EnablePersistence
member.summary: Enable or disable persisting Uploader state between page reloads. If enabled, the `Files` state will be persisted.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.EnableRtl
member.summary: Enable or disable rendering Uploader in right to left direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.Enabled
member.summary: Specifies a boolean value that indicates whether the Uploader allows the user to interact with it.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.Files
member.summary:
Specifies the list of files that will be preloaded on rendering of Uploader component. The property used to view and remove the uploaded files from server.
By default, the files are configured with uploaded successfully state. The following properties are mandatory to configure the preload files:
Name
Size
Type

summary.para: You can add the additional html attributes such as styles, class, and more to the root element.
If you configured both property and equivalent html attributes, then the component considers the property value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.Locale
member.summary: Specifies the global culture and localization of the Uploader component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.MaxFileSize
member.summary: Specifies the maximum allowed file size to be uploaded in bytes. The property used to make sure that you cannot upload too large files.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.MinFileSize
member.summary: Specifies the minimum file size to be uploaded in bytes. The property used to make sure that you cannot upload empty files and small files.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.Multiple
member.summary: Specifies a boolean value that indicates whether the multiple files can be browsed or dropped simultaneously in the Uploader component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.SequentialUpload
member.summary:
By default, the file Uploader component is processing the multiple files simultaneously.
If SequentialUpload property is enabled, the file upload component performs the upload one after the other.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.ShowFileList
member.summary: Specifies a boolean value that indicates whether the default file list can be rendered. The property used to prevent default file list and design own template for file list.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.Template
member.summary: Specifies the HTML string that used to customize the content of each file in the list.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.BytesToSize(System.Double)
member.summary: It is used to convert bytes value into kilobytes or megabytes depending on the size based on [binary prefix](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Binary_prefix).

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.Cancel(System.Object)
member.summary: Stops the in-progress chunked upload based on the file data. When the file upload is canceled, the partially uploaded file is removed from server.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.ClearAll
member.summary: Clear all the file entries from list that can be uploaded files or added in upload queue.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.CreateFileList(System.Object,System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Create the file list for specified files data.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.GetFilesData(System.Nullable{System.Double})
member.summary: Get the data of files which are shown in file list.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.GetModuleName
member.summary: Return the module name of the Uploader.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.Pause(System.Object,System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Pauses the in-progress chunked upload based on the file data.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.Remove(System.Object,System.Nullable{System.Boolean},System.Nullable{System.Boolean},System.Nullable{System.Boolean},System.Object)
member.summary:
Remove the uploaded file from server manually by calling the remove URL action.
If you pass an empty argument to this method, the complete file list can be cleared, otherwise remove the specific file based on its argument ("file_data").

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.Resume(System.Object,System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Resumes the chunked upload that is previously paused based on the file data.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.Retry(System.Object,System.Nullable{System.Boolean},System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Retries the canceled or failed file upload based on the file data.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.SortFileList(System.Object)
member.summary: Allows you to sort the file data alphabetically based on its file name clearly.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfUploader.Upload(System.Object,System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary:
Allows you to call the upload process manually by calling save URL action.
To process the selected files (added in upload queue), pass an empty argument otherwise upload the specific file based on its argument.

member.summary: Specifies the expression for defining the value of the bound.

member.summary: Specifies the CSS class name that can be appended with the root element of the MaskedTextBox. One or more custom CSS classes can be added to a MaskedTextBox.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfMaskedTextBox.CustomCharacters
member.summary:
Sets the collection of values to be mapped for non-mask elements(literals) which have been set in the mask of MaskedTextBox.
In the below example, non-mask elements "P" accepts values "P" , "A" , "p" , "a" and "M" accepts values "M", "m" mentioned in the custom characters collection.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfMaskedTextBox.EnablePersistence
member.summary: Enable or disable persisting MaskedTextBox state between page reloads. If enabled, the `Value` state will be persisted.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfMaskedTextBox.EnableRtl
member.summary: Enable or disable rendering MaskedTextBox in right to left direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfMaskedTextBox.Enabled
member.summary: Specifies a boolean value that indicates whether the MaskedTextBox allows the user to interact with it.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfMaskedTextBox.FloatLabelType
member.summary:
Specifies the floating label behavior of the MaskedTextBox that the placeholder text floats above the MaskedTextBox based on the below values.
Possible values are:
Never Never floats the label in the MaskedTextBox when the placeholder is available.
Always The floating label always floats above the MaskedTextBox.
Auto The floating label floats above the MaskedTextBox after focusing it or when enters the value in it.

summary.para: You can add the additional html attributes such as styles, class, and more to the root element.
If you configured both property and equivalent html attributes, then the MaskedTextBox considers the property value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfMaskedTextBox.Locale
member.summary: Specifies the global culture and localization of the MaskedTextBox component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfMaskedTextBox.Mask
member.summary: Sets a value that masks the MaskedTextBox to allow or validate the user input. If the mask value is empty, the MaskedTextBox will behave as an input element with text type.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.SfMaskedTextBox.Placeholder
member.summary: Specifies the text that is shown as a hint or placeholder until the user focuses or enter a value in MaskedTextBox. The property is depending on the FloatLabelType property.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderAsyncSettings.ChildContent
member.summary: Specifies the content that has to be passed.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderAsyncSettings.ChunkSize
member.summary:
Specifies the ChunkSize to split the large file into chunks, and upload it to the server in a sequential order.
If the ChunkSize property has value, the Uploader enables the chunk upload by default. It must be specified in bytes value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderAsyncSettings.RemoveUrl
member.summary:
Specifies the URL of remove action that receives the file information and handle the remove operation in server.
The remove action type must be POST request and define "RemoveFileNames" attribute to get file information that will be removed. This property is optional.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderAsyncSettings.RetryAfterDelay
member.summary: Specifies the delay time in milliseconds that the automatic retry happens after the delay.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderAsyncSettings.RetryCount
member.summary: Specifies the number of retries that the Uploader can perform on the file failed to upload. By default, the Uploader set 3 as maximum retries. This property must be specified to prevent infinity looping.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Inputs.UploaderAsyncSettings.SaveUrl
member.summary:
Specifies the URL of save action that will receive the upload files and save in the server.
The save action type must be POST request and define the argument as same input name used to render the component. The upload operations could not perform without this property.

member.summary: Enable or disable persisting component's state between page reloads.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Lists.SfListView`1.EnableVirtualization

member.summary: Enables or Disables the specified Accordion item.
member.param: Number value that determines which item should be enabled/disabled.
Boolean value that determines the action as enable (true) or disable (false). If the `isEnable` value is true, the item is enabled or else it is disabled.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfAccordion.ExpandItem(System.Boolean,System.Nullable{System.Double})
member.summary: Expands/Collapses the specified Accordion item.
member.param: Boolean value that determines the action as expand or collapse.

Number value that determines which item should be expanded/collapsed.`index` is optional parameter. Without Specifying index, based on the `isExpand` value all Accordion item can be expanded or collapsed.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfAccordion.HideItem(System.Double,System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Shows or hides the specified item from Accordion.
member.param: Number value that determines which item should be hidden/shown.
Boolean value that determines the action either hide (true) or show (false). Default value is false. If the `isHidden` value is false, the item is shown or else item it is hidden.

member.summary: Specifies the media query string for resolution, when opens the Sidebar. Example: assigning media query value to '(min-width: 600px)' will open the sidebar component only when the provided resolution is met else the sidebar will be in closed state.

member.summary: Specifies the position of the Sidebar.

member.summary: Allows to place the sidebar inside the target element.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfSidebar.Type
member.summary: Specifies the expanding types of the Sidebar. `Over` - The sidebar floats over the main content area. `Push` - The sidebar pushes the main content area to appear side-by-side and shrinks the main content within the screen width. `Slide` - The sidebar translates the x and y positions of the main content area based on the sidebar width. The main content area will not be adjusted within the screen width. `Auto` - Sidebar with `Over` type in mobile resolution and `Push` type in other higher resolutions.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfSidebar.Width
member.summary: Specifies the width of the Sidebar. By default, the width of the Sidebar sets based on the size of its content. Width can also be set in pixel values.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfSidebar.ZIndex
member.summary: Specifies the z-index of the Sidebar. It is applicable only when sidebar act as the overlay type.

member.summary: Options for positioning the icon in the Tab item header. This property depends on the `IconCss` property. The possible values are: - left: Places the icon to the `left` of the item. - top: Places the icon on the `top` of the item. - right: Places the icon to the `right` end of the item. - bottom: Places the icon at the `bottom` of the item.

member.summary: Sets ID attribute for the tab element.

member.summary: Child Content for Tab.

member.summary: Specifies the animation settings of the Tabs component. The animation effect can be applied to activate the tab with duration and delay.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTab.CssClass
member.summary: Sets the CSS classes to the root element of the Tabs that helps to customize the component styles.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTab.EnablePersistence
member.summary: Enable or disable persisting component's state between page reloads. If enabled, the tab’s selected item will be persisted.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTab.EnableRtl
member.summary: Enable or disable rendering component in the right to left (RTL) direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTab.HeaderPlacement
member.summary: Specifies the orientation of the Tab header. The possible values are: - Top: Places the Tab header on the top. - Bottom: Places the Tab header at the bottom. - Left: Places the Tab header at the left. - Right: Places the Tab header at the right.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTab.Height
member.summary: Specifies the height of the Tabs component. By default, Tab height is set based on the height of its parent.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTab.Items
member.summary: A list of items that are used to configure the Tabs component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTab.LoadOn
member.summary: Specifies the modes for the Tab content. The possible modes are: `Dynamic` Load the Tab content dynamically, which is rendering its content when switching its header. `Init` Loads all the tab contents on initial loading. `Demand` Loads the Tab content when required but keeps the content once it is rendered.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTab.Locale
member.summary: Overrides the global culture and localization value for this component. Default global culture is 'en-US'.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTab.OverflowMode
member.summary: Specifies the display mode which will be applied when the Tabs exceeds the viewing area. The possible modes are: - Scrollable: All the elements will be displayed in a single line with horizontal scrolling enabled. - Popup: Tab container will hold the items that can be placed within the available space and the rest of the items will be moved to the popup.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTab.ScrollStep
member.summary: Specifies the scrolling distance that applies when scrolling in Tab and enabled Scrollable mode.

member.summary: Specifies the index for activating the Tab item.

member.summary: Gets or sets a callback of the bound value.

member.summary: Specifies a value that indicates whether to show the close button in the Tab header or not.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTab.Width
member.summary: Specifies the width of the Tabs component. By default, Tab width sets based on the width of its parent.

member.summary: You can add the additional html attributes such as id, title etc., to the tab element. If you configured both property and equivalent html attribute then the component considers the property value.

member.summary: Specifies the location for aligning Toolbar items on the Toolbar. Each command will be aligned according to the `Align` property. Possible values are: - Left: To align commands to the left side of the Toolbar. - Center: To align commands at the center of the Toolbar. - Right: To align commands to the right side of the Toolbar.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemModel.CssClass
member.summary: Defines single/multiple classes (separated by space) to be used for customization of commands.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemModel.Disabled
member.summary: Specifies whether an item should be disabled or not.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemModel.HtmlAttributes
member.summary: Defines htmlAttributes used to add custom attributes to Toolbar command. Supports HTML attributes such as style, class, etc.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemModel.Id
member.summary: Specifies the unique ID to be used with button or input element of Toolbar items.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemModel.Overflow
member.summary: Specifies the Toolbar command display area when an element's content is too large to fit available space. This is applicable only to `Popup` mode. Possible values are: - Show: Always shows the item as the primary priority on the Toolbar. - Hide: Always shows the item as the secondary priority on the popup. - None: No priority for display, and as per normal order moves to popup when content exceeds.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemModel.PrefixIcon
member.summary: Defines single/multiple classes separated by space used to specify an icon for the button. The icon will be positioned before the text content if text is available, otherwise the icon alone will be rendered.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemModel.ShowAlwaysInPopup
member.summary: Defines the priority of items to display it in popup always. It allows to maintain toolbar item on popup always but it does not work for toolbar priority items.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemModel.ShowTextOn
member.summary: Specifies where the button text will be displayed on popup mode of the Toolbar. Possible values are: - Toolbar: Text will be displayed on Toolbar only. - Overflow: Text will be displayed only when content overflows to popup. - Both: Text will be displayed on popup and Toolbar.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemModel.SuffixIcon
member.summary: Defines single/multiple classes separated by space used to specify an icon for the button. The icon will be positioned after the text content if text is available.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemModel.Template
member.summary: Specifies the template that can be added as a Toolbar command.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemModel.Text
member.summary: Specifies the text to be displayed on the Toolbar button.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemModel.TooltipText
member.summary: Specifies the text to be displayed on hovering the Toolbar button.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemModel.Type
member.summary: Specifies the types of command to be rendered in the Toolbar. Supported types are: - Button: Creates the Button control with its given properties like text, prefixIcon, etc. - Separator: Adds a horizontal line that separates the Toolbar commands. - Input: Creates an input element that is applicable to template rendering with Syncfusion controls like DropDownList, AutoComplete, etc.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.ItemModel.Visible
member.summary: Specifies whether an item should be hidden or not.

member.summary: Specifies the width of the Toolbar button commands.

member.summary: Enable or disable persisting component's state between page reloads.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfToolbar.EnableRtl
member.summary: Enable or disable rendering component in right to left direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfToolbar.Height
member.summary: Specifies the height of the Toolbar in pixels/number/percentage. Number value is considered as pixels.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfToolbar.Items
member.summary: A list of items that is used to configure Toolbar commands.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfToolbar.OverflowMode
member.summary: Specifies the Toolbar display mode when Toolbar content exceeds the viewing area. Possible modes are: - Scrollable: All the elements are displayed in a single line with horizontal scrolling enabled. - Popup: Prioritized elements are displayed on the Toolbar and the rest of elements are moved to the popup. - MultiRow: Displays the overflow toolbar items as an in-line of a toolbar. - Extended: Hide the overflowing toolbar items in the next row. Show the overflowing toolbar items when you click the expand icons. If the popup content overflows the height of the page, the rest of the elements will be hidden.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfToolbar.ScrollStep
member.summary: Specifies the scrolling distance in scroller.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfToolbar.Width
member.summary: Specifies the width of the Toolbar in pixels/numbers/percentage. Number value is considered as pixels.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfToolbar.HtmlAttributes
member.summary: You can add the additional html attributes such as id, title etc., to the toolbar element. If you configured both property and equivalent html attribute then the component considers the property value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.DataSourceChangedEventArgs`1.Data
member.summary: Return the updated TreeView data. The data source will be updated after performing some operation like drag and drop, node editing, adding and removing node. If you want to get updated data source after performing operation like selecting/unSelecting, checking/unChecking, expanding/collapsing the node, then you can use getTreeData method.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1
member.summary: The TreeView component is used to represent hierarchical data in a tree like structure with advanced functions to edit, drag and drop, select with CheckBox and more. TreeView can be populated from a data source such as an array of data's or from DataManager.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.ChildContent
member.summary: Get the RenderFragment content.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.AllowDragAndDrop
member.summary: Indicates whether the TreeView allows drag and drop of nodes. To drag and drop a node in desktop, hold the mouse on the node, drag it to the target node and drop the node by releasing the mouse. For touch devices, drag and drop operation is performed by touch, touch move and touch end.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.AllowEditing
member.summary: Enables or disables editing of the text in the TreeView node. When `AllowEditing` property is set to true, the TreeView allows you to edit the node by double clicking the node or by navigating to the node and pressing F2 key.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.AllowMultiSelection
member.summary: Enables or disables multi-selection of nodes. To select multiple nodes: Select the nodes by holding down the CTRL key while clicking on the nodes. Select consecutive nodes by clicking the first node to select and hold down the SHIFT key and click the last node to select.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.Animation
member.summary: Specifies the type of animation applied on expanding and collapsing the nodes along with duration.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.AutoCheck
member.summary: Allow us to specify the parent and child nodes to get auto check while we check or uncheck a node.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.CheckedNodes
member.summary: The `CheckedNodes` property is used to set the nodes that need to be checked or get the ID of nodes that are currently checked in the TreeView component. The `checkedNodes` property depends upon the value of `showCheckBox` property.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.CssClass
member.summary: Specifies the CSS classes to be added with root element of the TreeView to help customize the appearance of the component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.Disabled
member.summary: Specifies a value that indicates whether the TreeView component is disabled or not. When set to true, user interaction will not be occurred in TreeView.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.DropArea
member.summary: Defines the area in which the draggable element movement will be occurring. Outside that area will be restricted for the draggable element movement. By default, the draggable element movement occurs in the entire page.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.EnableHtmlSanitizer
member.summary: Defines whether to allow the cross-scripting site or not.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.EnablePersistence
member.summary: Enables or disables persisting TreeView state between page reloads. If enabled, following APIs will persist. 1. `SelectedNodes` - Represents the nodes that are selected in the TreeView component. 2. `checkedNodes` - Represents the nodes that are checked in the TreeView component. 3. `expandedNodes` - Represents the nodes that are expanded in the TreeView component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.EnableRtl
member.summary: Enable or disable rendering component in right to left direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.ExpandOn
member.summary: Specifies the action on which the node expands or collapses. The available actions are, `Click` - The expand/collapse operation happens when you single-click the node in both desktop and mobile devices. `DblClick` - The expand/collapse operation happens when you double-click the node in both desktop and mobile devices. `None` - The expand/collapse operation will not happen when you single-click or double-click the node in both desktop and mobile devices.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.ExpandedNodes
member.summary: Represents the expanded nodes in the TreeView component. We can set the nodes that need to be expanded or get the ID of the nodes that are currently expanded by using this property.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.Fields
member.summary: Specifies the data source and mapping fields to render TreeView nodes.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.FullRowNavigable
member.summary: If this property is set to true, then the entire TreeView node will be navigate-able instead of text element.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.FullRowSelect
member.summary: On enabling this property, the entire row of the TreeView node gets selected by clicking a node. When disabled only the corresponding node's text gets selected.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.LoadOnDemand
member.summary: By default, the load on demand (Lazy load) is set to true. By disabling this property, all the tree nodes are rendered at the beginning itself.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.SelectedNodes
member.summary: Represents the selected nodes in the TreeView component. We can set the nodes that need to be selected or get the ID of the nodes that are currently selected by using this property. On enabling `AllowMultiSelection` property we can select multiple nodes and on disabling it we can select only a single node.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.ShowCheckBox
member.summary: Indicates that the nodes will display CheckBoxes in the TreeView. The CheckBox will be displayed next to the expand/collapse icon of the node.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.SortOrder
member.summary: Specifies a value that indicates whether the nodes are sorted in the ascending or descending order, or are not sorted at all. The available types of sort order are, `None` - The nodes are not sorted. `Ascending` - The nodes are sorted in the ascending order. `Descending` - The nodes are sorted in the ascending order.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.HtmlAttributes
member.summary: Specify the HtmlAttributes for TreeView.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.TreeViewTemplates
member.summary: Specifies the custom item template of TreeView Node item.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.ID
member.summary: Sets id attribute for the treeview element.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.AddNodes(System.Collections.Generic.List{`0},System.String)
member.summary: Adds the collection of TreeView nodes based on target and index position. If target node is not specified, then the nodes are added as children of the given parentID or in the root level of TreeView.
member.param: A list of nodes to be added to the TreeView.
Based on target nodes are added as children of the given parentID or in the root level of TreeView

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.BeginEdit(System.String)
member.summary: Instead of clicking on the TreeView node for editing, we can enable it by using `BeginEdit` property. On passing the node ID or element through this property, the edit textBox will be created for the particular node thus allowing us to edit it.
member.param: Specifies ID of TreeView node.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.CheckAll
member.summary: Checks all the unchecked nodes. You can also check specific nodes by passing array of unchecked nodes as argument to this method.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.CollapseAll
member.summary: Collapses all the expanded TreeView nodes. You can collapse specific nodes by passing array of nodes as argument to this method. You can also collapse all the nodes excluding the hidden nodes by setting excludeHiddenNodes to true. If you want to collapse a specific level of nodes, set level as argument to collapseAll method.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.DisableNodes(System.String[])
member.summary: Disables the collection of nodes by passing the ID of nodes or node elements in the array.
member.param: Specifies the array of TreeView nodes ID.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.EnableNodes(System.String[])
member.summary: Enables the collection of disabled nodes by passing the ID of nodes or node elements in the array.
member.param: Specifies the array of TreeView nodes ID.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.EnsureVisible(System.String)
member.summary: Ensures visibility of the TreeView node by using node ID or node element. When many TreeView nodes are present and we need to find a particular node, `EnsureVisible` property helps bring the node to visibility by expanding the TreeView and scrolling to the specific node.
member.param: Specifies ID of TreeView node.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.ExpandAll
member.summary: Expands all the collapsed TreeView nodes. You can expand the specific nodes by passing the array of collapsed nodes as argument to this method. You can also expand all the collapsed nodes by excluding the hidden nodes by setting excludeHiddenNodes to true to this method. To expand a specific level of nodes, set level as argument to expandAll method.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.GetAllCheckedNodes
member.summary: Gets all the checked nodes including child, whether it is loaded or not.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.GetDisabledNodes
member.summary: Gets all the disabled nodes including child, whether it is loaded or not.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.GetNode(System.String)
member.summary: Get the node's data such as id, text, parentID, selected, isChecked, and expanded by passing the node element or it's ID.
member.param: Specifies ID of TreeView node.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.GetTreeData(System.String)
member.summary: To get the updated data source of TreeView after performing some operation like drag and drop, node editing, node selecting/unSelecting, node expanding/collapsing, node checking/unChecking, adding and removing node. If you pass the ID of TreeView node as arguments for this method then it will return the updated data source of the corresponding node otherwise it will return the entire updated data source of TreeView. The updated data source also contains custom attributes if you specified in data source.
member.param: Specifies ID of TreeView node.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.RemoveNodes(System.String[])
member.summary: Removes the collection of TreeView nodes by passing the array of node details as argument to this method.
member.param: Specifies the array of TreeView nodes ID.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.UncheckAll
member.summary: Unchecks all the checked nodes. You can also uncheck the specific nodes by passing array of checked nodes as argument to this method.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.UpdateNode(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Replaces the text of the TreeView node with the given text.
member.param: Specifies ID of TreeView node.
Specifies the new text of TreeView node.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.Refresh
member.summary: Applies all the pending property changes and render the component again.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.RefreshNode(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{`0})
member.summary: Replaces the text of the TreeView node with the given text.
member.param: Specifies ID of TreeView node.
Specifies the new Data of TreeView node.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.GetRootElement
member.summary: Returns the route element reference of the component

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.MoveNodes(System.String[],System.String,System.Int32,System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Replaces the text of the TreeView node with the given text.
member.param: Specifies the array of TreeView nodes ID.
Specifies ID of TreeView node.
Specifies the index to place the moved nodes in the target element.
If set to true, the target parent node will be prevented from auto expanding.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Navigations.SfTreeView`1.UpdateData(System.Collections.Generic.List{`0})

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogAnimationSettings
member.summary: The class provides data for the animation to Dialog.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogAnimationSettings.Delay
member.summary: Specifies the delay in milliseconds to start the animation.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogAnimationSettings.Duration
member.summary: Specifies the duration in milliseconds that the animation takes to open or close the dialog.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogAnimationSettings.Effect
member.summary: Specifies the animation name that should be applied on while opening and closing the dialog. If the user sets Fade animation, the dialog will open with the `FadeIn` effect and close with the `FadeOut` effect. The following are the list of animation effects available to configure to the dialog: 1. Fade 2. FadeZoom 3. FlipLeftDown 4. FlipLeftUp 5. FlipRightDown 6. FlipRightUp 7. FlipXDown 8. FlipXUp 9. FlipYLeft 10. FlipYRight 11. SlideBottom 12. SlideLeft 13. SlideRight 14. SlideTop 15. Zoom 16. None

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog
member.summary: Represents the dialog component that displays the information and gets input from the user. Two types of dialog components are `Modal and Modeless(non-modal)` depending on their interaction with the parent application.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.ID
member.summary: Specifies the unique identifier

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.ChildContent
member.summary: Sets content for the Dialog element including HTML support and its customizations.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.AllowDragging
member.summary: Specifies the value whether the dialog component can be dragged by the end-user. The dialog allows a user to drag by selecting the header and dragging it for re-positioning the dialog.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.AnimationSettings
member.summary: Specifies the animation settings of the dialog component. The animation effect can be applied to open and close the dialog with duration and delay.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.Buttons
member.summary: Configures the action `Buttons` that contains button properties with primary attributes and the click events. One or more action buttons can be configured to the dialog.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.CloseOnEscape
member.summary: Specifies the Boolean value whether the dialog can be closed on pressing the escape (ESC) key that is used to control the dialog's closing behavior.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.Content
member.summary: Specifies the value that can be displayed in the dialog's content section.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.CssClass
member.summary: Specifies the CSS class name that can be appended with the root element of the dialog. One or more custom CSS classes can be added to a dialog.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.EnableHtmlSanitizer
member.summary: Defines whether to allow the cross-scripting site or not.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.EnablePersistence
member.summary: Enable or disable persisting component's state between page reloads.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.EnableResize
member.summary: Specifies the value whether the dialog component can be resized by the end-user. If the enableResize is true, the dialog component creates a grip to resize it in a diagonal direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.EnableRtl
member.summary: Enable or disable rendering component in the right to left (RTL) direction.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.FooterTemplate
member.summary: Specifies the template value that can be displayed with the dialog's footer area. This is an optional property and can be used only when the footer is occupied with information or custom components. By default, the footer is configured with the action buttons. If the footer template is configured to the dialog, the buttons property will be disabled.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.Header
member.summary: Specifies the value that can be displayed in the dialog's title area that can be configured with a plain text. The dialog will be displayed without the header if the header property is null.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.Height
member.summary: Specifies the height of the dialog component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.HtmlAttributes
member.summary: You can add the additional Html attributes such as id, title, etc., to the dialog element.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.IsModal
member.summary: Specifies the Boolean value whether the dialog can be displayed as modal or non-modal. `Modal`: It creates an overlay that disables interaction with the parent application and the user who should respond with modal before continuing with other applications. `Modeless`: It does not prevent user interaction with the parent application.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.Locale
member.summary: Overrides the global culture and localization value for this component. Default global culture is 'en-US'.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.MinHeight
member.summary: Specifies the min-height of the dialog component.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.ShowCloseIcon
member.summary: Specifies the value that represents whether the close icon can be shown in the dialog’s title section.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.Target
member.summary: Specifies the target element in which the dialog should be displayed. The default value is null, which refers to the `Document.body` element.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.Visible
member.summary: Specifies the value that represents whether the dialog component is visible.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.VisibleChanged
member.summary: Gets or sets a callback of the bound value.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.Width
member.summary: Specifies the width of the dialog.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.ZIndex
member.summary: Specifies the z-order for rendering that determines whether the dialog is displayed in front or behind of another component.

member.summary: Returns the dialog button instances by index. Based on that, you can dynamically change the button states.
